review_body: It is a hotel that you can find in a roadway in the middle of mainland.Absolutely overpriced, old furniture, old elevatpr, expansive parking, small TV, walls cracked, the bathroom is disgusting. Keep in your mind you probably paying more than 100USD here and not 40 bocks.If it costs 40 or 50 USD maybe it could be an option for someone.It is a rip off the 17USD named resort tax. Never but never more stay here again. Pay 50 USD and stay in a clean hotel but never here

Always very happy to be at the Ewa. It's like home. I missed the nice picture that was hanging on the wall when I first walked into the lobby. Also, you used to have little paper glasses with the water for a quick refreshing drink.

For its location and price, the Ewa Hotel is a solid choice in the Waikiki area. Sure, the physical condition of the rooms and hallways are not the newest or cleanest. But we got a room for three people that included three single beds, a TV, a two-burner stove, fridge, and microwave at a reasonable rate. Breakfast is not included, but the in-room wi-fi is stable and relatively fast.If you need a parking space (extra charge), be sure to check-in as early as you can, because there's a limited number of spaces available.The biggest annoyances were the added fees that are not included in the advertised room rate. That practice is so common among hotels now that it's confusing and almost impossible to compare total price, which is, unfortunately, exactly what hotels want to do.

Don't be deceived by the pictures posted online!!! Definitely on the contrary and were taken probably 30 years ago. It needs a complete renovation. Because of the scary condition of their one and only elevator, we used the stairs all the time. The only thing nice about this place is its location.

This place is horrible. Filthy. You just feel dirty staying here. Male front desk agent at night was very rude. No deadbolt on door. Toilet made noise all night. NO CLOSET OR HANGERS EVEN!!! No outside guests after 10pm. Very limited parking. Will never stay here again and suggest you don’t either.

Dated hotel, needs some updating. A little less expensive than other hotels in the area. Coffee provided was Excellent. No frills but all we did was sleep there anyway so it was fine. Walking distance to a beach. Long but walkable distance to the shopping. Elevator was clunky but worked. Covered parking area a bit small but was nice to have. Did not like paying the $30 extra a day for parking. And was not expecting an additional $130 cleaning fee, but we had booked through a different site, not Ewa directly.

The Ewa Hotel reminds me of a cross between some places I've lived. I've lived in cinder-block military barracks, and I've lived in an old building in San Francisco. Like the SF apartment, it's close to natural beauty. One of the reasons I chose the Ewa between the lower-cost hotels is that instead of window air-conditioning units; noise right over the bed, the Ewa has quieter units, and they work well. The other reason is proximity to Waikiki Wall / Queen's Beach. The cleaning staff is excellent and pro-active about removing wet towels to keep humidity down. One disappointment - the roof deck is not handicap accessible - the elevator stops the floor below. During our stay, the other guests were friendly and the staff was excellent. Advice from another review - get a balcony unit! Even though the balcony is small, we were very glad to have it.

This is another of the old-and-tired Waikiki hotels in desperate need of renovation and TLC. The price was right but you basically get what you pay for. Good location, on the quiet side of Waikiki and close to the beach, but definitely no frills and no amenities. The room and property overall are tired. The front desk staff all seemed less than excited to be there.

I booked this hotel last minute, 5 days prior to stay via Hotels.com, then tried to cancel 4 days prior because of an emergency. They were "happy to cancel" but no refunds were allowed. On hotels.com, I could cancel but Ewa hotel would charge a penalty that was the same amount as my stay. I think that's a great business model, to then make the room available to "other guests who may need a place" so they can sell the room again. But I am not ever going to stay here for the unsympathetic and inflexible approach they have to making money.

I checked in here as me and a friend were going out for a night of drinks and did the responsible thing and got a room to avoid a DUI. So we checked in and out the door in 5 minutes. This morning when we woke up I found BLOOD ON THE WALL and a chair has a dent on it!! Like someone had a party before I checked in. I better not be charged for this as I reported this things. I was told housekeeping will be up.. No housekeeping ever came. I felt disgusted looking at blood on the wall and no one coming I showered in case there are more blood in the area. With having the feeling that this isn’t important to them I checked out and reported to the gentleman in the front. His excuse was “maybe they were waiting for you to check out” so to tell me you rather wait for someone to have contact with blood that can contain viruses that can survive 1 week outside of the body. Didn’t have the feeling they cared enough with my complaint as I wasn’t yelling and remain calm and respectful. Side note. Hotel runs out of parking quickly so be aware and get parking early. Room was nice and good. Except the main complaint above. Hotel is a bit hidden but value was great. Great place for the price but customer service isn’t their strong ability.

This is one of the better budget hotels. It is also an older property but the amenities, especially for Kamaaina's makes It a great deal.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, and you bet I'll be staying here again, versus Pagoda or Ambassador Hotel.I stayed her for 6 nights for work, so needed parking. The day I checked in, parking was sold out, so they recommended the zoo which is close by. My room had a comfortable bed, and room was clean. Shower was clean, and water hot. AC cool, no problems at all. My only complaint is one elevator, but it is an older hotel.Kamaaina use their website for specials because it is an Aston Hotel property.The person I interacted with the most is Justin at the front desk, who was very friendly and helpful.I read all of the reviews on another review site, and it's like people pay cheap and expect high class. In this hotels case, you get way more then you pay for.

This may not be a high-end resort like the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach, but their staff, especially hotel manager, Maryknoll, made sure my requests were followed through. Upon my arrival, I had no complications whatsoever like I had at Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach. My room with a king bed was ready on a high floor at the end off the hall, just as I requested with hotel manager, Maryknoll, day before my arrival. Upon my checkout at 12noon, hotel manager, Maryknoll, sincerely apologized for no late checkouts, because of a group arrival, and extended her arm with her business card and said if you need anything else, please don’t hesitate to call me. Overall, this hotel may not be a high-end resort like Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach, but their staff and manager just know how accommodate their guests needs without complications.

Staying here beginning and end of May to break the trip between Australia and the US and Canada and return to Australia we found the motel handy to the shops and Waikiki Beach and surrounds. First stay found us in a clean and comfortable room with lanai. Staff friendly. However, lift was broken for 1 day which meant carrying our bags up 4 flights of stairs.Return visit we were placed in a very small room adjacent to lift - part of an adjoining suite I assume as there was a locked door in room and we could hear the voices and TV of next room. Felt very uncomfortable with little walking space and one partner had to get out of bed by climbing to the end of bed as it was against the wall. Tap on bathroom basin faulty and we worried we might be held accountable if it completely failed. Not acceptable. We requested another room and the staff obliged.Our biggest problem was the $15.00 per day service fee which includes US Today (overseas visitors have no topical interest in this paper), water in the foyer (why would you bother sitting in a small foyer to drink water), replenish coffee in room daily (this is normally a part of motel service and the coffee sachets only allow for 2 cups a day), shuttle to Ala Moana shops which one would only use once in a short stay of 3 days and local phone calls which most US motels provide as a part of room costing. This fee also allows for Internet access and in room safe which most motels provide free of charge anyway and additional inclusions (whatever that means). One has to pay this fee but in my opinion it is a form of "made up greed" for more money.An old motel but clean and tidy overall.

Location is great, but don't think your getting the best of the best. Front desk desperately needs a new desk, roof, furniture, clean windows, etc. As for the room, I didnt even want to stay here after witnessing nothing but stains, nasty vents, shower was moldy, and room smelt of mold. Stove looked outdated MAJORLY, and the room just smelt out. From what I was told from an employee, they weren't able to get an update on the resorts, cause their sister resort needed to get done BEFORE this one. In my opinion, this resort should have been the TOP one on my list to get replenished and fixed! BEWARE!!

Mold was growing on the inside of the bathroom door. This makes me wonder if the have cleaned their Air Conditioning system ever.The room had an unpleasant odor. They make you pay an additional fee to use their WiFi and facilities when you check in.

We enjoyed staying at the Ewa Hotel because of their rates and the distance to Waikiki Beach. We arrived before our room was ready, and had no problems leaving our bags there till our room was ready. The hotel is 2 blocks from the beach, which made it close enough to easily walk there, but far enough to avoid some of the noise. The hotel also offers a sun deck on the 8th floor, which is a great place to enjoy a cool drink and take in the rays.

Nothing fancy, but clean and reasonable. Location close to things, within walking distance. If you cannot walk, make sure you get on the 7th floor or lower, the 8th floor can only be reached by walking the stairs.

Not a luxury hotel but it includes many small touches that made our stay very comfortable.ToasterMicrowave2 burnersReal cups and glassesVery quiet air conditioningOn a quiet streetCompassionate staffCleanComfortable beds

I know its a 3 star hotel but I draw the line when there are roaches in the room. I will not come back in this place. I have never killed so may roaches in my life. Cleanliness was a so-so.The only good thing is the location.

Economic prices, good and clean rooms, excellent location. Staff were also kind, I hope we can stay there again soon. I can't add any more details because it's a simple hotel with no extra service, we got what we expected.

First off I’ve stayed at this hotel many of times and loved it. But now I don’t know when I was checking in now there’s a security deposit of $200.00 which is really outrageous and it’s not even stated when booking through the hotel website. Which it should be so there’s no surprises when getting there. And the LAST day we were there maintence had to come in our room at 9:00 in the morning to fix the cable and WiFi .... I don’t know why they could’ve waited until we left to check out.

After reading the reviews and not having a lot of options booking a hotel in Waikiki mid Dec for Christmas time. we didn't know what to expect. Arriving at the hotel we found the staff very helpful our room was spacious and clean. Everything worked. Yes they are a little dated but clean. Our room had a queen size bed a balcony a small fridge and a stove top. The hotel is close to everything. The internet worked fine for what we needed it for. You can get beach towels from the front desk. All in all for the price it's a quaint little hotel. If your expecting grand views of the Pacific and room service this is not for you. If you want practical and a 2 min walk to the beach and inexpensive this Hotel fits the bill.

Paid about $30 less a night than adjacent hotels were charging and the price showed in the condition of the hotel's amenities. It could definitely use some updating. But that's partly a "get what you pay for" thing and that is on me, not them. I have to say that the staff there is phenomenal (super nice and helpful) and the location can't be beat. It's about two blocks to the beach with lots of retail and dining around. Overall, not a bad experience given the price point, but if you're looking for something a little more than just a place to rest your head after a day in the ocean, you may choose to spend a bit more elsewhere.

So if you’ve ever wanted to stay in a 3rd-world hotel without having to travel to Haiti or Nicaragua, this is the hotel for you. Cracks in the walls. Peeling paint. Rusty shower curtain poles. No pool. No ice machines. And don’t even get me started on the towels!!! When I checked in around 10pm after an exhausting day, I wanted a hot shower before bed. All that awaited me in the bathroom was the cloth floor mat. I just wanted to go to bed so I used that. The next day, I lodged my complaints and the front desk “person” apologized. But throughout the remainder of the week, this continued. One day, no washcloths. The next day, no hand towels. Most days, no washcloths, hand towels or floor mat. And they failed to clean the shower/bathtub the entire week until I finally raised hell.

I stayed at Ewa for five nights by myself, and I got a twin-bed room for the entire stay (yes, I requested king bed before my visit but the staff insisted I did not). By the way, this hotel made my stay pretty comfortable even though the price is quite high compared to the quality of the room. This hotel offers a great location (close to the bus stations, Waikiki Beach, and Diamond Head Crater). The staff were pleasant and helpful; the housekeeping was excellent!

We reserved a room at the Hotel for the 18 th September 2018. The room seemed satisfactory, so we were shocked after an outing to see several cockroaches of different sizes when we returned. The girl on reception was sympathetic, but said the hotel was full so we couldn't be moved. She ordered that the room be cleaned which consisted of a man with a disinfectant spray who asked us to vacate the room for about 30 minutes. shortly after we returned-the insects re-appeared-The whole saga was then repeated. We demanded that the man leave the spray with us. Our last day in Hawaii was ruined. We feel that the entire fee of $118.99 should have been cancelled.We did not feel cared for as a guest should be. You did acknowledge how unsatisfactory things were by waiving the amenities fee of $15.77. I remain shocked very disappointed and dissatisfied.

I stayed in what they call a moderate room. No desk, no balcony, noisy elevator shaft on one side of the room, thin adjoining door on the other. Room was fairly clean but no soap or shampoo on arrival plus the bath mat was filthy. The bed sheets had been changed though. Comfortable bed. Only 2 cockroaches in 5 nights. Upstairs patio was filthy and unorganized. Front desk staff was very attentive and helpful.It's a 2 star hotel so I was not disappointed.

Stayed over Thanksgiving holiday. Here are my comments:1. Great location. Walking distance to the quiet side of Waikiki beach (2-3 minutes) and the main strip of dining and shopping along Kalakaua Avenue (10-15 minutes walk). Bus stop is nearby along Kuhio & Paoakalani (2 minutes). Trolley stop for tours in front of Aston Waikiki (2 minutes). ABC Store is nearby (2 minutes). Great restaurants nearby as well.2. Excellent service. Staff was pleasant and friendly and went the extra mile to accommodate a special request. They made sure to keep rooms clean and fresh.3. Reasonable rates. They claim to be a 2-star category hotel and rightly so. You’ll get one of the cheapest prices here. But I recommend not to expect much. 4. Needs a huge renovation. Everything about the hotel is dated and needs to be replaced. While everything was in working order, it is obvious that Father Time has taken its toll. They are aware of this and I was told that they are just waiting for their turn to be renovated as other hotels in the chain are listed ahead.5. This hotel will really enable you to save. Apart from the great rates, there are kitchenettes where guests can prepare their own food. I found this useful for breakfast. I microwaved oatmeal daily and saved money on buying breakfast (please note that the hotel does not provide breakfast). A microwave, twin stove burner and sink are available as well as a refrigerator. Overall, while the amenities are poor due to age, the service made up for it. I would consider staying here again for my future trips. Tip: Manage expectations.

*WIFI non existent, even though they said they contacted supplier and was getting fixed, to no avail, read other comments and seems it just never gets fixed. Told to connect to the signal which showed the strongest. what a laugh..*No hot water even after them "resetting the hot water system"*Room smelt really bad*Studio room with kitchette left a lot to be desired. looked terrible. Hotel really needs to be updated.*TV needs to be updated to a bigger one, way too small.*Room very small.*Air conditioner very loud. *location is ok *Lift very shaky, wouldn't open on my floor nearly freaked out so had to go back down to the lobby then try again.. Was very unsure about trying again.*House keeping very loud in the morning walking through the corridor, I guess my room being located near the lift didn't help much.

Absolutely no WiFi that connected. We were told it worked, but it never did. We didn’t have hot water for a day. The place is a dump, but it is close to the strip. I do not recommend this hotel at all. Pay the extra money and stay elsewhere.

We knew there was a chance the reality would not match the pictures so we were not disappointed. Overall, the hotel is worn but clean. It's HI so we anticipated having to share our room with a few extra guests (roaches) which we quickly evicted with a shoe. If you just need a place to sleep and bathe for a reasonable price, and close to the beach, this will probably work for you. If you're looking for luxurious accommodations and amenities, this is not for you. Turn one way and you're at Denny's; turn the opposite direction and you're at Starbucks. Walk across the street and you're on the beach. If you keep walking (15-20 minutes depending on how fast you walk), you're at Cheesecake Factory and a high-end, designer shopping center. We stayed 4 days and 3 nights combining business with a working vacay.

First of all, location of hotel is good, friendly staff and hotel room was comfortable. However, wifi was absoloutly abysmal. Was told to connect to the hotel wifi with strongest signal...this did not work at all in the room. It would constantly drop in out of service or it would connect and then disconnect after about 1 minute. Air con wasnt working for first couple of days, didnt worry about it as there was a nice breeze. Notified reception when it was needed as it was muggy. It worked for one day and went to use the next day and didnt work again. Didnt bother asking to get fixed again as the breeze came back for the last couple of days.

Our family of three was in Oahu for a couple nights before hopping over to another island and the Ewa was exactly what we needed: a reasonably priced, comfortable hotel in a good location for a short stay. Pros: Price (relative to other places in Waikiki), location (short walk to the beach and pretty easy access by car to other nearby sights). Comfortable beds. In-room fridge was handy. Lots of eating options nearby for all budgets. Our room was on the seventh floor and we enjoyed a quiet, undisturbed stay. No lanai but could catch a glimpse of the ocean from the window which was unexpected. Front desk staff helpful and friendly.Cons: Yes, it's an older property but seems well maintained. The one elevator is old and slow, but better than nothing ... just be prepared to wait. Parking is nearly non-existent and expensive (par for the course in Waikiki). Of those that do exist, the spaces are very tight and hard to get into. We felt lucky to find the Ewa and I must say I've spent more for lesser places in previous trips to Waikiki.

Good-bad-good:Good: Location is great! Right in Waikiki and Diamondhead in sight. Numerous shops and restaurants very close. Bad: When we first got there, they put us in a tiny and umbelievably noisy room. It was like sleeping IN the elevator and RIGHT NEXT to our neighbors' TV. Would have ruined our stay on Oahu. However,...Good: ...once we talked to the front desk they immediately gave us a beautiful and quieter room and we had a wonderful time!

Awesome location lovely staff but hidden charges the anemities cost you 17.00 a day extra on your bill. Not sure why everything can’t just b straight forward That charge was for newspaper which I never saw and shuttle service which I never used and internet we are in the middle of a medical emergency and really don’t need the surprises added to an already expensive scary time

The Ewa Hotel was just what I wanted. It's a budget conscious hotel near the beach, waikiki strip, the local bus and an awesome food truck (Mami's Empanadas). It is a good hotel (decor is of the 80's) with friendly staff. It's maybe not as fancy as those on the strip, however it is clean, friendly and recommended for its price point. The rooms have enough space for you to spread out, bathroom is good and beds are comfy and on site laundry at an affordable price. We opted for a kitchenette to save $$ on meals and opted to do breakfast ourselves most days using the facilities and getting supplies from ABC Store or Food Pantry. Good location at the Honolulu Zoo end of the strip.

Considering it's in Waikiki and only 5 minutes from the beach, this is a good choice for the budget conscious traveller. Yes, it's a bit dated but our room was huge and the beds comfy. The 3pm check-in time is a bit late, if like us, you had a long overnight flight.

Run down budget hotel. Would be amazing if they put some repairs into it, and cleaned it up.I don't think I would stay here again. Our room was large, but unwelcoming.. We got one of the bigger suites on the roof and it had so much potential. Very quiet.. Almost too quiet...

Great location. Clean and quiet. One of the cheaper hotels in the area. A few minutes walk to the beach. Microwave and fridge in room. Coffee machine in room. No breakfast included. Slow and small elevator. Receptionist very friendly and answered all my questions about Diamond Head.

I stayed at the Ewa Hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii in October of 2017 while I was playing lacrosse in the 2017 Hawaii Lacrosse Invitational! This hotel is within walking distance to Kapiolani Park, the beach, Lulus Bar and Grill, Tikis Bar, Eggs N’ Things, Cheese Burgers in Paradise, and much more!

It's a 2 star hotel, so you get what you pay for however the staff is incredible! Seriously, they are top notch. Our room is bug free and doesn't smell 'funny' like some reviews state. The only downside is the carpet always leaves our feet dirty, but once again, it's a 2 star hotel - we just wear our sandals, problem solved! Besides, who spends any amount of considerable time in a hotel room when you're in Hawaii?? I pity tje man who does. We have slept great, noise levels outside of the hotel is city level noise, so don't expect to hear only ocean waves crashing - you won't even get that at a 5 star hotel here in Honolulu. We've had neighbors on both sides the entire stay and we haven't heard them through the walls at all. Well worth our money and we'll definitely be back to the Ewa Hotel!!

The staff is always friendly and helpful. The moderate room was perfect for what I needed and was at a reasonable rate as well. This is my first choice when booking a room. I would def recommend it to anyone I know.

Staff seem friendly and helpful. Which is why I rated 3 stars The bad smell coming from everywhere such as old carpet, pillows, elevator etc.It needs a major maintenance. Everything around seems really old. From the handle in the bathroom to fence on the balcony.

been bitten by bed bugs here! its cheap i know but its not worth it! stay somewhere else! im thankful that its only bed bugs! but what if its something else like tick the one that carries chagas disease. this is a warning to all of you.

This hotel is in a good location, only 2 blocks from the beach and parks. It is an older hotel that could use some upgrades but we were not in Wakiki to stay in our room. Bed was comfortable, air conditioning worked well. The room was clean. Internet was 15 dollars extra cost per day. Lots of restaurants close by. We went to the ABC store, less than a block away to purchase items to have breakfast in our room everyday. This helped save money and time for going on tours like the pearl harbour and oahu circle tour. Staff was very friendly, we were given a bottle of wine when we arrived for our anniversary! And very affordable price for Wakiki, which is extremely expensive. We enjoyed our 4 night stay.

If you are just looking for a place to just sleep and shower then this one is for you! Nothing exceptional here. I booked for 7 nights there for 2 rooms with a kitchenette from November 29 to December 6, 2017, but managed to transfer to Marriot Hotel on the 5th night. For some reason, we didn't get the best front desk receptionist (the older dude and bald ). He is always grouchy and unapproachable for some reason. Second nigh I asked if there's a possibility for me to get an extra coffee but I can't because my resort fee only cover for one small bag of coffee and I have to pay extra $15 for that. Hotel lobby is dirty, one old elevator that smells tobacco and will take you to 7th floor and if you're on the 8th floor you have to use the stairs. Rooms are pretty basic, old and smells bad..dysfunctional kitchenette and dirty yellowish towel. Chambermaids are wonderful by the way. You always get a good greetings from them every morning before you head out to the beach. When I checked out on the 5th night the young receptionist guy was very nice and he apologize for what had transpired and what my friends and I experienced was unacceptable..so I got a refund equivalent for one night of stay. Any how my advice for some travelers like me is have plenty of time to do your homework and know exactly what are you looking or expectations when it comes to your accommodation.

this hotel was booked by my agent and ended up being good value for a waikiki/close to beach hotel with great staff,big rooms and easy access to everything,its not your 4/5 star type but older and just right for people on a budget.abc shops nearby and across the road from the marriott plus right near the bus pickup for all the local tours-ie-pearl harbor/arizona,my reason for this visit-my first and well worth the effort,i,d return for a longer stay.

I work on ships and have spent many a port call over the past 10 years in this clean, fairly priced, and friendly hotel. I love the peace and quiet, conveniently located on a lightly travelled side street, close to the park, zoo, restaurants and the beach. There is essentially no traffic noise, rare in Waikiki. The staff are helpful and welcoming with warm aloha. They even went out of their way to help me get a better room. Be warned though, the wireless Internet service in the rooms is terrible and is often non-functional. Why they haven't done anything about this problem is a mystery considering we're living in a connected world. Sure, the rooms could use some updating, but everything was clean and perfectly adequate. I always seem to find my way back here and will likely return on a future port call.

My wife and I spent 16 days in Kauai and Maui, and instead of flying directly back home afterwards, we decided to spend one night in Waikiki. We figured we would probably be up late dining and shopping, and up early the next morning to catch our flight so we didnt need anything fancy. Based on reviews and price, I chose the Ewa Hotel. I am so glad I did. I have stayed in the Aqua brand of hotels in the past and always found them to be clean, well located, and good value for the money. This trip was no different. We arrived early, around 11:45 am, and as I expected, our room was not ready. Not a problem, the desk clerk took our bags and locked them up securely and told us to check back around 2 pm and we should have your room ready then. We walked around Waikiki for a bit, did some shopping, ate lunch, (see my California Pizza Kitchen review), then headed back to the hotel. At this point, our room was ready. We were told that since I was an A-Lister, we were being upgraded to a one bedroom suite instead of the least expensive studio I had reserved. What a nice surprise! The room was huge, with three beds, separate bedrooom, and huge connecting balcony. After we unpacked, someone from the front desk even came up to our room with bottled water and cookies. The staff here is amazing. Always smiling and willing to help. And all this for about $100 and a free upgrade. The hotel itself is on the older side, and its been awhile since a renovation. But it was clean and functional. Its on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki, which I prefer since it is a little quieter down there. Plus you are a quick walk to the park and away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. But its also only a five minute walk the other direction to either the beach or all the commotion of Waikiki. Great location in my opinion. It is a low rise hotel, dwarfed by the high rises around it. If you want to stay in your room and look at the view, you might want to go elsewhere. But we walked five minutes to the beach and enjoyed the view from there and saved several hundred dollars. The beds were comfortable, the mini fridge was great, all in all a clean although dated room.The bathroom could have used some improvements. Remember this is a budget hotel, though. But there were cracks in the porcelain sink, the shower curtain was off a little, but nothing that stopped it from being functional. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

I travel on business, usually on short notice. I booked this hotel as the least expensive hotel in the general vicinity of a conference I was attending in Waikiki. I had relatively low expectations, but was pleasantly surprised with a room that was clean, well maintained, and had more amenities than I was expecting. There were several nice touches:two walk in closets. One has an ironing board and iron, the other has a set of dishes and silverware.Kitchenette including microwave, range, sink and refrigerator. I made use of this, storing take-out meals in the refrigerator and reheating them in the microwave. The dishes in the closet came in handy.Radio alarm clock. Most newer hotels don't have this anymore.I was told that there are laundry rooms on the 2nd and 4th floors, but I did not make use of these.DISADVANTAGES:There is no restaurant in the hotel. The nearest restaurant is in the next hotel over, maybe a 200 yard walk.The hotel has wifi but I forgot to bring my laptop. I asked to use a desktop computer but they don't have an internet café or other guest access to computers.There is a hostel next door to the hotel. Several nights there were young people standing in front of this hostel at all hours and some of these people looked dirty. I am an extra large guy and was not afraid to walk past them.

The Ewa has been a favourite of ours for 10 years and it hasn't really changed a bit in that time. It doesn't stand a chance against the glitzy resort hotels like the Kahala, the Royal Hawaiian or the Trump Tower, but you are going to be flapping about in your wet swimsuit and water wings wherever you go, so who are you trying to impress? The Ewa Hotel does have aloha in bucket loads. Great staff who really care about you, friendly service (thank you, Michelle) and genuine Hawaiian hospitality. It doesn't have a pool - the ocean is one block that way. It doesn't have a restaurant - there are 20 within 5 minutes walk. It doesn't have a bar - save yourself a few hundred dollars on the hotel and have another round of mai tais at the Tiki Bar around the corner. Free beach towels, excellent local advice on tours and restaurants, comfortable rooms. Love this place.

The rooms are clean but in need of updating. The furniture is from the 1970's or so. TV was up to date as it was flat screened (we never turn it on). Everything worked and was clean. We were there for everything else, not the room. It didn't matter much to us that it was not updated, as we were in the room only to sleep and shower. Great location and price.

This is a run down hotel property. The walls are paper thin, the amenities are very sub-par, and you get what you pay for unfortunately. Yesterday we had no fresh towels or linens because we were told someone forgot to do the laundry. In a hotel! The staff have been very friendly, but the noise and poor amenities do not make up for it. Spend a little more money and move to a better property. This is not worth your time or money.

This was my14th stay at Ewa Hotel since 1997. The location is close to the beach and convenient to several nice restaurants and also fast food restaurants. The entire staff was knowledgeable and very friendly. My room was clean and the housekeeping service was great. I look forward to future stays.

I, was checking out and unfortunately read the review before this. I, guess we were staying at a much different hotel. The Staff @The Ewa Hotel was kind, courteous and knowledgeable. I, found the rooms to be well-sized and immaculate. The maid service was spot on. And, quite frankly. I, didn't have tot extend my stay.. But, "I, COULDN'T STAY AWAY..!"

One of the worst hotel I ever stayed! It seems to me that the owner do not want to spend more money on maintenances of this hotel. We stayed on the third floor the room and furniture is old and old and worn out, at my next room it’s was a dog barking for hours because his owner was gone! Don’t be fool by the many years old nice pictures!

I can't express enough how courteous and helpful the whole staff was. Always smiling and greeting you every single time they see you, helping with anything from directions, making copies of news articles, to giving you fresh supplies after housekeeping is long gone. The hotel was clean, the beds very comfortable. The Wi-Fi could use a little improvment but i would most definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel. You can't beat it either for reasonable prices.

It was amazing! The staff treats you like family and its a clean environment. The rooftop deck isn't all that fancy but it has quite the view of everything around it. Its tucked away in a nook, but it is close to Waikiki and you can walk to nearby resturants that are open at late hours.

We booked two stays at Ewa Hotel one for two nights and after our trip to Maui for six nightsOn our first visit we arrived at about 1.30pm and were told check in is at 3pm so we went out and returned 3pm to be told the room was not ready so decided to wait and were told that there is also an Amenities charge of approx $14 per night which gives you such things as coffee Newspaper Internet etc which for me was the first time I have ever encountered this charge for things normally included.Internet is important for us and to say the least it was terrible and I would say for any one who needs to stay in touch with business things as we do，that it was totally unreliable during our stayThe lift in the hotel is in much need of an upgrade but the room's were acceptable for the price considering it's an older hotel also the staff we encountered quiet friendly.

I had to pay for the WiFi, and the internet connection keeps dropping out, very very frustrating. There was a dog nearby that was barking occasionally, very annoying. The room was not ready when it was time to check in. The whole place looks old and needs a big makeover or fixing up. The lift is slow.The street outside can be very very noisy with motorbikes hooning and revving up their motors super loudly.Kitchenette is very basic, very small and no electric jug. You have to boil water with pot on a stove.

Overall was awesome. We had a great room with amenities, the location was great, easy access and the service was wonderful. Love the aloha spirit, friendly and the hospitality of the staff. I would recommend to friends and family. Close to everything!!

A smaller older style hotel but in a quiet yet convenient location close to the beach, convenience stores & restaurants, aquarium, zoo and public transport. Staff were friendly & helpful, room clean though somewhat tired but good value for the price. WiFi was a bit intermittent in our room (5th floor) but better in the lobby. Partly self contained facilities (fridge, microwave & stovetop cooking in room), no restaurant but vending machines & laundry in building, secure covered parking available. Other amenities available (eg DVD hire, paper etc). Well worth a stay if you wanted a cheaper less impersonal hotel without the luxury & prestige of the more conventional & upmarket hotels found nearby.
Very friendly and warmhearted people working at this hotel. Not just some, but all I met... Doing whatever they can to solve problems quick and unbureaucratic.Don't forget to check out the roof deck!

Words can not begin to express how wonderful we felt here, an absolute haven.With all the staff (both reception and cleaning ladies) genuinely beautiful people, caring, friendly so helpful and spotlessly clean rooms. We have been back twice on our Hawaiin ventures and if and when we return to Waikiki the ewa hotel is are home. Just wished most other places had your hearts and love. Thank you all at the EwaPs (doug and tracey)

We just enjoyed our stay at the Ewa Hotel in Honolulu. Check-in Hostess Michelle, and also the Manager there were so pleasant and accommodating to ensure a comfortable stay. Amenities include a free movie rental machine, a large mini frig, microwave, range, 2 sinks, and balcony! This was especially nice after busy days spent touring. We would definitely stay there again!! :-)

pros:1. Budget friendly. With the same (even lower) per night rate as other Waikiki hotels, I got a really large one-bedroom suite at Ewa. The bedroom alone is bigger than a more expensive hotel I stayed last year two blocks away.2. Super friendly staff. The front desk guy and the housekeeping lady were very helpful.3. It has everything we needed. mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine, iron, stove top, etc. TV and AC worked fine.Cons:1. The building is SO OLD. everything looks crappy. I would say it is the worst looking hotel I've ever stayed in the US. the elevator was slow, shaky, and smelly.2. The room was dirty. The floor seems never been vacuumed. Hairs from previous guest in the bathroom, gross!3. WIFI is very unstable.4. Noisy. Tour groups come and go all the time. You will hear them talking extremely loud.5. You can hear EVERYTHING from next door. I mean, EVERYTHING. So embarrassing.Tips:The elevator only goes to the 7th floor. If they give you a room at 8th floor, you'll have to walk all your luggages upstairs. Also, the 8th floor suite does not appear as the web pictures. There's only sofa bed in it.I would not say Ewa is bad, but if I'm not so short on money next time, I definitely won't stay here again.

This hotel is ideal to sleep well and have your own privacy if you do not want to spend your nights in a Hostel. It is also ideal for couples & groups. They offer courtesy coffee in your room, it is very tasty and the beedrom size is perfect. The front desk staff is really helpful and they are always available to help you in case you need to book a taxi or to know where to go during your stay. They do not offer breakfast, but you have many ABC Stores & coffee shops to have breakfast or to go. I definetely will back to Ewa if I come back to Hawaii once again.

I stay in hotels about 8-12 times a month for both business and leisure and when it comes to standards, I set high expectations….normally I would stay at the Hyatt Centric or the Alana Doubletree or even the Aqua Pearl…..BUT ONLY IF THE EWA HOTEL IS BOOKED. Here is why….a couple of times I’ve ran into complications checking in….lost reservations, card complications, lost or forgotten wallet and let me tell you, when it comes to hospitality and extending the Aloha Spirit, Roy of Ewa Hotel Waikiki, sets the standard. Backed by his warm and generously hospitable supervisor Douglas, they embody the true meaning of Aloha Spirit. As a local and native Hawaiian, it makes me proud to know that he is in the forefront representing our people…..HE REPRESENTS US WELL! This hotel is a hidden gem….it brings back old fashion hospitality and customer service and serves it in an affordable price with quality accommodations. I LIVE FOR THIS TYPE OF SERVICE….Thank you Roy and Douglas for making me feel welcomed on your property. MAHALO ❤ tyra sablan ❤

Had a wonderful 25 night stay. Everything was great. We have stayed here 6 years in a row. Great location. Great staff. Great value. In perfect location. Helpful yes. We will return here as soon as we can.

First let me start by saying that the staff was amazing. So friendly and sweet. They bent over back ward to make our stay great. I will single out Tracy who worked the desk the night we checked in. He was kind and make us feel at home. Every time we saw him it was quick with the "hello" and a smile. The room was clean and comfortable. A block away from the beach was a plus. Dont have one bad thing to say about the Ewa hotel.

I am being generous in giving this hotel two stars. The only reasons it didn't get one star is that I saw no bugs and the bed was comfortable. Other than that, Ewa Hotel is a shitbox. The room was tiny, which isn't a huge deal, but there was no closet or even a rack on which to hang clothing! We were in Honolulu for a wedding, so we wanted to hang up our clothes to keep them fresh and wrinkle-free. Nope. The room doesn't even have an iron. I called and asked for one and was brought an iron and ironing board, but no closet, rack, or iron in the room was kind of odd. We were out of the hotel by 8 am on our first morning and when we got back at 2:00 pm, the room had not yet been cleaned, despite having the "please clean our room" sign hanging on the door. We retuned to the room for about an hour and the toilet became clogged, but we figured housekeeping would take care of that when they cleaned our room. It was never cleaned, even when we left the room (for the wedding) a little before 3 pm and didn't return until after midnight. It was late and we were tired, so we got ready for bed. I turned on the TV and wasn't able to change the volume or the channel and couldn't turn it off. Our toilet was still clogged and the smoke alarm in our room started beeping LOUDLY! I called the front desk and a maintenance man came up about 15 minutes later to change the batteries in the smoke alarm. He also handed me a plunger wrapped in a garbage bag. I had to plunge the toilet myself! Mercifully, I had gotten the TV to turn off but was afraid to turn it back on in case the remote got stuck again and I had to endure the TV noise all night.

Not a bad little place to crash. Cheap and offered a two burner stove, microwave, fridge and dishes. I would recommend washing dishes again before use. Had free DVD's to watch a long day at the Beach. Two Blocks away from Waikiki Beach. Had a balcony which is nice to sit on or dry towels. Nothing classy.

Stayed twice in last week there, super convenient for beach, zoo, and short walk to where more of the main action is.Was on a budget so room rates were pretty reasonable - but on arrival had to pay an extra tax not included in online booking (hotel fee, tax, wifi etc- circa $13/day) which surprised me, and surprised other guests checking in at same timeStaff on reception friendly and helpful. And apologetic about extra $ charged.Had different rooms on each visit.Rooms are basic, and dated, decor wise but clean, with very comfy beds, pillows and linen. Rooms with balconies (lanai) are roomier, but they overlook street, no beach views as 2 blocks back from beach.Self catering rooms are crazy basic (had to ask for cutlery!)

My favorite place to stay now for several years because of friendly staff especially Tracy, Etsu, Doug and GM Lendy who treat you like family. The rooms are clean thanks to the always cheerful maid cleaning crew and the beds comfortable. The location is also nice at east end of Waikiki near kapiolani park and diamond head. I highly recommend.

This hotel is so amazing words can't even begin to describe it although I am going to try. Ok first of all I have been here so many times I have officially lost count. The staff are really really friendly and helpful and they just go above and beyond to make sure you have the perfect stay. This past time I was here I got to check-in 2hrs early and even when I went to checkout they let me store my luggage there until I was able to come back and pick it up. In addition every single room I have stayed in has been extremely clean and comfortable. The bed is really nice and soft. It always has extra bathroom linens which I love and hey don't even get me started on the Playstation3 stationed in each and every room. I love it! And with the free unlimited DVD/video game kiosk downstairs who would want to leave? I think what makes this place so special to me is the fantastic deal you get for what you're paying. Where else can you get free wifi and a free shuttle and everything else listed above for such a spectacular price? You can't. That's all I have to say. :) Ewa Hotel Waikiki is simply the best and I highly recommend it to everyone.

We are extremely pleased with this hotel. The staff is excellent. The rates are fantastic for a hotel with location so close to the beach, bus transportation, casual dining and shopping. The rooms are larger than most and the decor although bit dated are maintained excellently. Loved our stay.

I can not express enough how absolutely WONDERFUL the staff is. My fiancé and I are staying with the hotel as we settle into moving to Hawaii. The staff were so accommodating and made us feel like family and not like just another customer they are making money off of. Doug, Edsu and Michelle, literally take customer service to a whole other level. If you ever want to experience the Aloha spirit at it's utmost best, THIS IS WHERE YOU WANT TO BE.

We have stayed at many hotels here in Hawaii and the Ewa Hotel is by far one of the best. Why? Excellent customer service, housekeeping, and great location within a reasonable price. Michelle, Tracey, Etsu, and Douglas rock the place. Thank you for everything that you do! :)

Stayed at the Ewa for a few days. Location is good, close to Waikiki. The hotel is older & could use some TLC, but the staff were super friendly. I would come back to stay with this hotel if I came alone again. I'm not that fussy so it may depend on who I travel with again

This is a budget hotel. Rooms were spacious and it close to everything. What made this hotel a 4 star for me was the staff!! The front line staff were fabulous - Michelle, Tracey, Etzu (sp?) were so great to deal with and helped in any way they could. Anytime we requested anything, we received it very quickly. I am an experienced traveler, and this hotel is top notch for staff helpfulness and friendliness! Our cleaning lady Christina was fabulous and our room was always spotless, plus she worked around our schedule without complaint! The maintenance man (can't remember his name), was always so pleasant and funny! I don't plan on going back to Oahu (too much like a city for me and not enough "island vibe"), however, if I ever did return, I would stay at the Ewa Hotel again.....mainly because I loved the staff!

Whilst the motel is only 6 levels high nestled amongst towers, it is a terrific, affordable option. The room was 30 sq m, large for Hawaii, had a kitchenette (2 burner stove, saucepans, frypan, egg flip, coffeemaker, microwave), good size toilet/bathroom, large TV, 2 queen beds, table & 2 chairs, armchair plus a small balcony with 2 chairs & small table. These were a little dirty but being outside, easy to understand. We had a partial view of Diamond Head. Price quoted included daily convenience fee plus all taxes, shuttle to Ala Moana, coffee every day, towels and accessories as needed, 24hr front desk, free DVDs, and super friendly & efficient staff. Only one lift, but it was very quick and the stairs were any easy option (from our room on 3rd floor). Nothing was any trouble at all. 1.5 blocks from Waikiki beach & around the corner from most tour pick ups, it was great for our budget. I'm disappointed I didn't take photos of the room to show how spacious it was. After speaking to other travellers at more luxurious hotels, this one was large. Only disappointment was the WiFi, hardly worked at all. Starbucks on the corner took care of that

My partner and my young son stayed at the Ewa for 7 nights during the news years eve period and we were all so happy to be there. It's a hidden gem!! On arrival we had such a warm welcoming. We felt at home instantly. Our rooms were beautifully presented n clean. We had a kitchenette with everything we needed. The beds were comfy n had free access to DVDs n PlayStation on the nights we wanted to stay in. Free wifi too. From our balcony we had a view of diamond head. The rooftop was a great place to relax. We had the view of the sunset. We met some great fellow travelers up there. It is in a great location. Nice n quiet. It's only 2 streets back from the beach and duke ( 2 min walk) and right near the zoo. Everything was very easy to get to. Plenty of food places around and there's an abc store on the next corner which came in handy. But they are everywhere! HahaThe staff were amazing!!!! Whatever u needed they always did their best to help and make our stay as comfortable as Possible. A special mention goes to Michelle at the front desk of the Ewa. She was incredible!! Michelle is very professional and kind hearted. We loved seeing her. She definitely helped in making our holiday the best to date by far. Looking forward to coming back.. Thank u Ewa!!

There is a resort fee of about 14.00 per day, that fee includes WiFi, use of the in room safe, and a few other things that seem a little nonsensical. Parking on website says $15 per day, but front desk says $25 per night. Bed was comfy, but our room 315 was awkward. Very small. Granted we were only in it to sleep, but the walls are very thin and we could here everything in room next door. Location is great, away from hustle and bustle of the front street, Kalakaua Ave, but only a 3-5 minute walk from the beach. Only about 15 parking spaces, so get parked and hope everything you want to do is close by to walk to.

Pro:PriceClose to BeachComfortable BedCleanCons:Charges "Resort" FeeDated furnishingsParking is $25/nightView Very LimitedLow Quality AmenitiesJust needed a short stay so decided to look for someplace inexpensive. Room cost me about $122. However the resort charges of $13 + "Resort Fee." I find this to be offensive because basically it's just a price increase that they don't advertise. Setting the resort fee aside the room was adequate. The bed was comfortable. There was a headboard with two fairly sturdy post coming off of each side. I was upgraded to a kitchenette which was a sink with a two burner stove. There was also a mini refrigerator, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. They provided some dishes including a very small saucepan and frying pan. So it would be possible to fix yourself a meal. I did not so I cannot comment on how well things work. The room had a small flat screen TV which provided good picture quality. There was a PlayStation 3 which doubled as a DVD player. They had a DVD kiosk in the lobby. I did not use it so I cannot comment on the selection of movies. This was part of the resort fee so they provided a card that you could use to check out the movies at no additional cost. The room also had an in-room safe, ironing board, iron and hair dryer. Over all the furnishings and carpet were dated but clean. Room size was good. There was a very small table with two chairs to eat on, and a relatively comfortable sitting chair. Bathroom had a very shallow tub / shower enclosure. The fixtures were definitely dated but the water was hot. They did provide soap, so called conditioning shampoo and lotion. These would rate at the very low end of quality for hotel amenities.Air conditioning was an older split system which worked well.The location is on one of the side streets in Waikiki. It is about a block from the Honolulu Zoo and 3 block from the beach. Overall the location is good. It was relatively quiet. However there was absolutely no view. Only one small window in the room which faced another building.The building has WiFi . On this day it wasn't working particularly well, so the management waived the resort fee.The hotel charges $25 a night for parking. This is pretty common in Waikiki. However I refuse to pay it. You can park on the Ala Wai for free if you don't mind a several block walk. However, if you choose this option be sure to move your car on Monday and Friday mornings between 8:30 and 11:30. The city is very aggressive about towing cars during these hours.Overall a good choice if you're looking to reduce your expenses while staying in a convenient location and Waikiki.

We weren't expecting much when booking a room at the Ewa Hotel in Waikiki but was pleasantly surprised after checking in . The room was super clean and included a kitchenette. Location was perfect for all the tourist things in Waikiki. Lots of really good restaurants close by. We would definitely stay at this Budget friendly Hotel again.

The room was clean and bed was comfortable. Sometimes there was a lack of towels but the staff were very kind to bring them to me after a call.The hotel is not by the beach and lower than the building around so you could not expect any ocean-view or city-view from there. Just a comfortable place for having a rest after a long day trip around. Or before your early climb to the diamond head to see sunrise. :)BTW, the shuttle bus they promised at the front of a sister hotel never showed up after wasting us about 1 hour ... You'd better find other way by yourself.

2 blocks from beach, good staff, and kept clean. Seems like a good deal for expensive Waikiki, except for the wifi charges. Their wifi is almost non-existent, which is not great if trying to access online maps or bookings for tours, etc. Ended up going outside for wifi, get a better signal from nearby Park Shore Hotel while sitting at the beach! Very basic amenities, so don't expect much other than the cleaning service to replace towels and tidy room once a day. The "kitchenette" is small, but helps save money on breakfast and lunches. Pleasant place for the budget-minded.

Stayed 5 nights in November and have mixed feelings about the hotel.Pros:Great location – less than 5 mins walk from Waikiki beach and also convenient for getting to other places of interest.If you’re not hiring a car from the airport you can get the city bus from the airport for $2.50 which stops just around the corner from the hotel.ABC convenience stores near the hotel, great for stocking up on bottled water.Very friendly and helpful front desk staff.The room was very spacious. Comfortable bed. TV, safe and fridge in the room.Complimentary shuttle (you have to go to a hotel around the corner to be picked up) to Ala Moana.Cons:Convenience fee – advertised as $13 per night for 1 DVD/game rental a night, room wifi (connection not reliable), shuttle to Ala Moana (great if you’re not in a rush to get there as it stops at several other hotels and timings are a bit sporadic), daily sachet of coffee in the room (what about tea drinkers?!), daily newspaper… However, my booking confirmation showed that I only needed to pay an additional $45.29 for my 5 nights and I even e-mailed the agent before my trip to confirm this was all I needed to pay. They confirmed this directly with the hotel but once I got there the hotel asked for $52.35 (yes it’s still lower than the $13 per night but since I could have happily done without all the extras, it’s the principle) and I couldn’t have checked in without paying it. I did e-mail the agent while there who to their credit were prompt to act but they were told by the hotel manager that the $45.29 did not include tax – hmmm, the max tax a company can charge in Hawaii is 4.712% so that makes no sense either…(plus when I checked out the bill showed the daily convenience fee as $10 plus tax of 4.712%, so 0.47).Housekeeping – the room wasn’t as clean as it could be. There was a small pile of sand in the bathroom along the edge of the bathtub when I checked in and it was still there when I left. The toilet seat had a "stain" which I had to clean off before using. The fridge and wash basin area (the wash basin is outside the bathroom) had ants wandering about, when I pointed this out to the person who came to replace my bedside lamp lightbulb on day one, he proceeded to squash them with his fingers and then pointed out that the last resident had spilled coffee over the fridge (where the electric cafetiere was) and it hadn’t been cleaned properly.I had a room on the 8th floor and the lift only went up to the 7th then you have to climb up the fire escape stairs to the top floor. This is not a major issue but should be highlighted to anyone who may have issues climbing stairs.I would have rated the hotel 3 out of 5 however having a stranger wake you up at 3am on your last night by walking into your room through the door from the interconnecting room, which should have been locked, not a pleasant experience. Now when I first arrived in the room I did check that door to see if I could get into the other room and while my side could open, the other one was locked. I still put the luggage rack with my case against that door at night and it’s a good thing I did as the person shoving the door open knocked that over and that woke me up. Apparently they had just checked in and was wondering what was through that door. Anyway, when I phoned the reception to ask if they had the key to the door (it wasn’t a simple turn a lock from my side) they said hadn’t housekeeping locked the door, to which I replied someone just walked through!

Only stayed 3 nights,but room was fine, don't be fooled what the hotel looks like from outside. Arrived at hotel and was little dissappointed at the front of hotel and lobby,but was pleasantly surprised about the room, it was spacious and clean. The hotel is reasonable priced for Waikiki Beach, it is up a little back alley, but is in a great location, only 5 minute walk to beach

Very clean, minimalist hotel in a terrific location. Hotels are expensive in Waikiki but this is about the best in the reasonable category. Close to lots of things , including pick up from tour companies.

Location is great, staff is friendly and had some great breakfast suggestions, room had plenty of room with a good bed and nice facilities.I booked through expedia and its an after thought that there may be an additional fee....there was. $14 "convenience fee" for wi-fi,movie rental, hotel safe, shuttle, etc. I said I dont need that stuff but had to pay anyway. Now to their credit, the wifi was down from about 7 hours after I got there till I left so they waved that fee.The place feels like it is in a constant state of renovation. I didnt have a balcony and no drying line in the bathroom. I lived in my trunks the whole time there so at the end of the day you need to hang dry them and a towel, no dice.Price is right, location is good, the rest you can make work. Its not a place for everyone but it grew on me after a while.

I just spent 6 nights here and loved the location and the staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The room itself was tired and the bathroom a bit worn out. The shower base was really bad with dark worn through patches in many places. Like some other reviewers have said - it was noisy. I was above the lift so could hear the gears churning all the time. The gap under the room connecting door meant I could hear every word my neighbours said. If you have already booked this hotel - take your ear plugs!

We found this Hotel thru Booking. Com and glad we did! Great clean rooms 1 block from Waikiki beach and park ! Management very friendly and very helpful ! We would recommend this hotel to anyone ! Rooms are nice and most have kitchens and a terrace! Great experience for sure! Thank you Ewa hotel ! Andre from USA mainland

The hotel interior is outdated but it's clean and the 3bedroom family suite we got has balcony, 2 bathroom and kitchen so we were able to cook breakfast. The location is perfect. Walking distance to the Beach, restaurants and Shopping center.

The location of the hotel is Ok but if you're planning to stay at this hotel, think twice. They've inconsistent pricing policy and that they'll charge you in a way that there is no another day. They're good at emptying out your pocket money. Initially, I'd planned to stay here for 2 weeks but had to leave in 2 days. Thanks god, I could return back to my home safe, sound and with some savings else would have been onto the streets as all of my money would have been taken away by this hotel. Think twice and confirm the price of the room thrice before making your final decision. My room confirmed at an average of US $ 115 a night or so and had to pay US $ 170 a night, ripped off!

I will write it again cause it seems it "doesn't appears"; the noise was horrible i had to share a "connecting door" from one room to another one and i couldn' t change of room because the explanation was that "every standard room is the same"; it was expensive (almost 2000 dollars) Also i refered that i heard shouts screems and kicking of doors (it seems it was a drunked or drugged person) in front of my bedroom. The only good point is the location.

The hotel itself is a little older than the others in Waikiki in the way it looks, the corridors, rooms.The place does not in any way reflect the staff. They went above and beyond for my boyfriend and I, every person I spoke to whether it be front desk staff, or housekeeping or even the electrician! Everyone was so helpful, kind, understanding and genuine. We got the room on the first floor with a balcony in the corner and unfortunately the wifi could not reach, and after several calls to front desk and numerous apologies from their part, they removed the daily fee but still gave us all the benefits such as the free shuttle bus to the ala moana shopping centre. During our stay I booked another room for my family member and again, the same great service. The rooms were always clean and well serviced. Fresh towels and extra towels whenever we needed it. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone whom are on a budget, but appreciate brilliant ohana service. Great location near the zoo and aquarium, a very short walk to the beautiful Waikiki beach, and at the quieter end of the strip, where you are not bombarded with the huge rush of tourists but still near the hub of the action. Great shopping spots nearby and food joints where the locals eat. Hotel 3/5 Hotel staff 5/5 Mahalo ewa hotel until next time! XxxAloha!

The Ewa doesn't have a pool, a exercise room, or any of the upgraded facilities, but it's the best hotel I've ever stayed at! I've traveled all over Europe and the US and have stayed at some extremely nice hotels, and some dumps. I came to Waikiki and had booked the Ewa through the internet. The rooms are exceptionally clean, the staff extremely friendly, and you are treated like family! My favorite desk clerks are Etsu and Tracy. They treat you like family, and know your name. It's a small hotel, but they have to ask your room number, they know you as a person, not as a room! The General Manager, Lendy, became a friend - and upon our leaving gave me a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts. We had had a conversation about how much we both loved chocolate and the nuts a few days ago. I heartily recommend this hotel, and its employees. Super sweet employees, clean rooms, extremely comfortable beds, and the best customer service I have ever encountered in a hotel!

Great value at far end of waikiki, close to zoo, park and surf. Friendly staff. I'd recommend for a brief stay in waikiki. Will come again. No view and some street noise, parking can fill up at times.

This is the perfect place to stay when you want a Waikiki fix. Short walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping.Clean rooms and wonderful staff at checking and checkout.A quite little hotel on a side street.

For a two night stay that cost close to $700, this place is a dive. The pictures on the web site are outstanding, however that's not what you get. Upon arrival the only stall that was available for parking was the handicap stall which for me was ok, since I am disabled. Check in was wonderful, Tracy at the front desk was friendly and said we didn't need to pay the $25 a night parking fee since we had handicap parking but that it was on a first come first serve bases.After checking in we went to our room which was very disappointing and sad looking. There was trash left in the dresser and a bag of trash in the closet, the additional room in our 2 bedroom suite w/kitchenette was actually a one bedroom room that was adjoining which they forgot to unlock the door to. Traveling with kids, expected one entrance to room so I wouldn't need to worry about an additional door.Went downstairs to talk with check in staff. He said he was sorry and would send someone up to help us.So a wonderful worker named Marc came to take out the trash and open the room, he was very understanding and kind. Upon opening the room, we were all blown away with the smell! The room had a musty wet mold smell which was horrible, allergies acted up immediately on 3 of the kids. Went down stairs to see if we could move rooms due to the condition of the room and was told that they were booked but they would remove the $13 a night convenience fee. Told Tracy that I would like to speak with manager, but he wasn't in yet. Explained to him that I was very disappointed with the room and that the mold is a health issue. Since there were no other available rooms and also rooms at other hotels were not available, me & my 5 kids (on the competition team) turned the ac on high and had to suck it up.Upon return from dinner, we found a box of chocolates and a bottle of apple cider waiting for us on the dresser. Of course that made the children happy and I am grateful for that since it brighten there night.I did make it very clear to Tracy that I was very upset with the price I paid for such a dump (mold smell in room, trash in room, mold in shower, mold on bathroom mirror, broken shower handle, and simply the room looking so dingy - this was not worth $700). He said he would speak with his manager and I told him I would appreciate that and he would see what they came up with at check out.Upon check out, the clerk was rude and cocky. When I asked him what type of arrangements would be made to my bill he said "oh yeh! we not going charge you for parking." I tried to explain to him that I wasn't being charged for parking due to parking in the disabled spot. He said, "yeh! I know, but you was supposed to move so as what we not going charge you for." I again tried to explain to him that I was told that I wouldn't need to pay to park there and he insisted that I refused to move my car and they were helping me out by not charging me. Since we had a competition to get to and I felt he was not understanding what I was trying to say that I would just leave, obviously a waste of time to talk to someone who is dead set in getting his way.What I actually expected was that the GM would have said due to the mold smell in your room that was confirmed with our employee Marc who had to open the door to the adjacent room for you folks and since we were not able to move you to another room we would comp the second night of your stay and that we are truly sorry for the inconvenience. Not worth the money or the cocky attitude of morning staff. Please remember that our check in staff Tracy & the gentleman he sent to help us in the room Marc were very kind and understanding. But, as always it just takes one bad apple to spoil the bunch.

Pros: Convenience to the beach. It's on the far side of Waikiki (near the Honolulu Zoo).Cons: Moderate rooms could use a microwave. Definitely an older hotel that could use some renovation.Location: Close to Waikiki beaches - about 2 short blocks. ABC Store and a bus stop are about a block away. Tourist restaurants are also within walking distanceTraveling alone. 6 nights. Had a "moderate" room with 2 twin beds, mini fridge, & TV. A decent hotel for the most part and will suffice in terms of having a place to sleep while you're on vacation, so it's worth the price. One of the beds was right underneath the AC so I kept having to adjust the AC temp so I wouldn't get too cold. Internet was kind of wonky. Depending on the time of day, you couldn't access the WiFi networks. There were times that I had to use my cell phone as a personal hotspot. No real complaints. My experience was, overall, hassle-free. The staff were very friendly. Got checked in an hour early. I was greeted each time I left and returned to the hotel. Would definitely stay again if I was on a budget.
user_name:
Ben P
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: The room was clean with 2 single beds and a day bed which is only 5'6" long. It took a couple of minutes of running the water to finally get it warm in the shower. The fridge did not work but did not complain as we did not use it. What annoyed me though was having to pay for the "included" wifi fee even though I did not use it. Overall, the staff was friendly and the location of the hotel is fantastic!

If you're looking for value and cleanliness this place is for you. Nothing fancy but very clean. Could use some updates but for the money and location it fits the bill. Staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable. Kitchenette with all the things you need. Newer TVs, balconies. There's a parking garage, nice little courtyard out front. Waikiki beach is within walking distance.

We had an enjoyable stay at Ewa Hotel. The room and amenities are lovely and the staff were very helpful. The location is very good for the beach, shopping and nightlife. We will definitely recommend Ewa Hotel.

My girlfriend and I got a bad room, kind of dirty. Our room ( like many others) was completely different than which you can see on pictures... If you just want a room to sleep in Waikiki that's okay but I would not recommend it and would not comeBack there...

The hotel is close to Waikiki beach only 5-8 minutes walk, and the next day I needed to join a tour and found the gathering place was only 3 minutes walk ! It was so convenience and I have a good stay at the hotel, with a beautiful sunset. If I visit Waikiki again, I will choose Ewa again.

The room was a bit of a disappointment as it was not as pictured but as I always say to myself all it is, is a place to rest my head and not a place I'm going to be very much while on vacation. We had the studio room with a kitchenette which I didn't even really use. The room was well kept and clean. All staff meet were extremely nice and helpful! The hotel is a block and a half away from the beach and on the other side of the block from a sort of boardwalk. Almost literally across the road from the honolulu zoo which I recommend.

On the upper end of Waikiki, this hotel (motel?) was equipped for the business traveller. Away from the hoi polloi, a bit of a walk to main-stream (to be fair, plenty of public transport out on the rear street) it suited perfectly. It's not at all flash like those Hotels along the beach front, nor does it aim to be, but great value for $ and everything that is needed, including a kitchenette. Ewa has parking for those who need it (left my car at home in Sydney on this occasion) and wifi was fine, as it is throughout HNL. Front desk staff helpful and friendly, as were the staff in the building.

This is probably the worst hotel experience I've had thus far. They refused to accommodate me and my disability and they refused to refund me. Besides the fact that I had to park half a mile away because they "ran out of parking", they gave me a room with 2 small beds even a child couldn't fit on and I'm a big guy. Finally, the elevator is scary and slow. I thought it got stuck on me.

We booked this hotel with United Air package to Hawaii for 5 night stay in Waikikii beach. This hotel was very well located to ocean and walking to all attractions in Waikikii. The room was spacious with a Kitchen and Patio, 2 very comfortable beds. The hotel staff were very friendly and directed us to various activities. The front desk Mr. Etsu made sure our stay was memorable Hotel is a hidden jewel if you looking for bang for the buck in Waikikii. I plan on returning in the near future to this Hotel.

We located this Hotel on trip advisor and were very happy when we arrived.Brulliant large room, comfortable bed/ great views and very friendly staff.I would recommend this hotel to any Australians visiting this amazing destination.

The hotel is in a great location, very close to the beach and restaurants.The rooms are OK for a budget hotel even if the bathroom would need a revamp!!The kitchenette is well equipped with toaster and microwave which comes in handy if you are planning to save some cash.Only downfall is the "hospitality fee" of $10+tax which doesn't even include parking which cost extra $25 per night.

This hotel is under two blocks away from the main beach in Waikiki. Loved the location. There are many places to eat nearby, transportation is close-by--and, of course, ABC Stores are everywhere! The room was fine (let's say serviceable), we don't spend a lot of time in the room, so we didn't use the kitchenette much either. The room could use an upgrade, but then you wouldn't be getting the lower prices. The staff was courteous, and very helpful.

we booked it very last-minute just like a few days before arrival and the hotel is closely located to everything, beach, promenade, shopping, restaurants. hawaii is a paradise and if staying on oahu island definitely visit waimea bay, north shore and kailua beach, we travelled the island in 4 days and we basically only slept and showered in hotel so we did not need any 'spa style' place to stay. clean, tidy, as said previously 'functional' hotel, with a roof top terrace where we met other travellers from all around the world, very friendly and easy going. aloha waikiki

If all you need is a bed and a shower. Then this is the place. Affordable, clean and friendly staff. Two blocks away from the best part of Waikiki Beach, no hotels down to the water. No breakfast but you can find places to eat close by. No view of anything. But I didn't care. Only spent time there sleeping.

We recently had a 9 day stay at the Ewa Hotel in Hawaii. Situated in a quiet street but very close to Waikiki Beach and all shops. There were ABC shops very close that catered for everything you would need . Although an older hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were particularly helpful, the cleaning lady (especially on 7th floor) was exceptional. Our room was a great size and always cleaned each day. When we come back to Hawaii, and we will, the Ewa Hotel will be our choice. Congratulations to the team.....you made our stay very enjoyable

I did not find any faults with that hotel at all. I captured a discount deal - 100 USD per night (including taxes and resort fee) and for this price it was an excellent catch, considering the location and room standard. I had an en suite double room with AC, TV, fridge, coffee machine, free local calls, locker, shuttle, DVD rental all included into price. The room was nothing fancy, but everything worked, staff was efficient and friendly and hotel very safe. And it is in the prime location! Main area of Waikiki beach is just 5 min walk, and so are shops, cafes, restaurants, tour agents and bus stops to all kinds of destinations. Central nightlife areas are about 10-15 min walk. The nearby hostels sell crappy private rooms for a much higher price. Normally this hotel is more expensive but if you catch the deal then it is a real best kept secret for a budget traveller! I would definitely stay again and would recommend also.
