Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Not bad for a budget, short stay hotel and very close vicinity to Waikiki beach and St. Augustine Church, which was a blessing since our stay was during Easter. Staff are very helpful and friendly. I felt comfortable in the room and slept well especially since I changed our stay from a hostel at the last minute and I was very grateful I did for the privacy and comfort. Due to it being spring break the hotel sold out immediately after I booked. There's a small stove top in the kitchenette in the room which I never used but if I had stayed longer it would've come in handy. For a small room, not a bad amenity to have if you'd rather cook a meal. The beds are super comfy. If you're looking for convenience, thrifty and a comfortable night's sleep this is the place to stay for $90/night plus a $10 amenities per night charge. Considering the location and it was a popular time of the year, that price range was affordable especially if you compare to other budget hotels and hostels around the area. I would've paid the same rate a night at a hostel that wasn't comfortable and had no privacy plus sharing the room with 5 other strangers.

The hotel is a nice 2 star hotel. The cheap rate worked great for a day use room during our 10 hour layover on Oahu. Unfortunately we couldn't check in early, but were able to park our car and use their common bathroom to change into our bathing suits. We walked a block down to Waikiki beach, had a lovely day and came back at 3:00 to check in. We told them we'd be checking out in a few hours, so the really nice front desk staff waived the parking fee and daily hotel fee. The room was dated, but clean. It had an older kitchenette, TV and three beds. Nothing fancy, but suited our needs and would be perfect for somebody on a tight budget. The location is great, close to everything. Be aware, the small parking lot fills up quickly. If you're on a budget, this is a great option.

One block back and about five minutes walk from Waikiki beach front this place is close to all the action and restaurants but in a reasonably quiet location. One of the older and smaller scale hotels it is clean and kept in very good condition, and unlike you insist on great views it is the ideal base for a few days.

Spent 7 nights here...found it clean with comfortable bed and a pleasant room with enough room. Can't say I found the staff that helpful..however they did offer information and help if we requested it....the 10.00 per day surcharge to cover DVD. .shuttle..WiFi. .coffee etc..was worthwhile to us as we used all these facilities ...however the DVD player is a bit if a trick to use as it is a Playstation. ..we stayed on the 8th floor and only had to use the stairs once..Overall a pleasant stay in a clean hotel with a great location..would stay here again and recommend. .many thanks..

Very good location. It is close to the beach and it's at the end of Waikiki. Nice restaurants and shops are there for you! The staff are helpful and friendly. Surprised for the Comfortable bed:) Towels were a little bit old but clean. No complain for this price though.

We had to switch from our previous Airbnb accommodation due to personal reasons. We just found low budget Ewa Hotel online within walking distance from the beach and just walked in asking for a last minute 7 nights booking. The young front desk lady was very helpful and understanding. She found us a solution within our budget but we have to switch room once during our stay - totally fine with us. We parked our car either at the zoo during the day or on Kapahulu Ave - a block away from the hotel - at night for free. Ewa Hotel has parking onsite too at extra cost. Some rooms haves mall kitchenettes while others only have microwave, coffee pot, utensils and minibar. The room was cleaned daily. There is a rooftop as well - it doesn't have a great view but it's good to relax or sunbath with chairs provided. You can rent movies with the kiosk machine in the lobby - included in your hotel fee. I find the movie selection is quite up to date. Hotel ground is very clean. Walking distance to lots of good restaurants and convenience stores. They provide free round trip shuttle to Ala Moana Blvd as well - pick up location is another hotel around the corner. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Helped me store my long kayak in the locked recycle bottles area for one night. Oh they have locked cage for surf boards in the parking lot as well but my kayak wouldn't fit in. Helped me print a document at no charge. Also stored our luggages so we didn't have to bring them around on our last day while waiting for our flight. Good experience overall

Best hotel for price and location! I have stayed here 4 years in a row now wouldn't stay anywhere else! Close to everything(beach, zoo, restaurants, shopping) ! Staff are awesome! Clean rooms. Best bang for your buck when on a budget! 3-5 min walk to the beach! I wouldn't consider anywhere else!

Fabulous location, older hotel in need of some repairs but the price was right, it was clean and the staff was super helpful. it is hard to find decent priced accommodation in Waikiki and this hotel was and excellent find. I would stay here again in a heart beat

Pleasant stay, Rooms were clean, service was kind and helpful. Unfortunately Internet access was hopeless. Some amenities should be renovated, replaced for new ones. Location is perfect, just minutes away form Waikiki Beach.

Short Version:The Staff are amazing! Very helpful and friendly. Great location and price for waikiki strip.We were allowed to check in 4 hours early. However...The hotel is in serious need of repair and TLC. The rest of my review will be about the negatives.Long Version:This is not a 2 start hotel, it is a zero star. Think of a motel 6 or a random $30/n highway motel. That's what you are going to get at Ewa Hotel in Waikiki.We purchased the 1BR suite. It was on the 3rd floor, facing northeast (road side). Upon Arrival, these were broken: both sinks, toilet, shower, stove area, and the ps3. As an example, the stove was not grounded! Only the major items were repaired (took 4 hours). But this did not hinder us to much, as we only slept and cooked in the hotel. The staff have their hands tied.The largest problem were the windows. Occupants smoke in the courtyard and it goes straight into the room 24/7. The windows are not tinted, which allows anyone walking on the street or in another hotel to see right into the room. Lastly, the noise! You will hear a garbage truck three times a day... right next to your head. You will will hear street conversations clear as day. Try having a two year old take a nap. The next painful item was the 'kitchenette". Imagine cooking with out any counter space, washing dishes with one mini sink, a mini fridge that cannot hold a half gallon of milk, and almost no light. You pay a daily resort fee for internet access. When it worked...the speed was under 1megabit.Bottom line: We had a great time, but only outside the hotel.

We couldn't be happier with our stay at the Ewa Hotel! We stayed for 14 nights at room 614, located right in front of the elevator and it had a partial view to the beach and to the hostel. The location, at just a block away from the beach, and near every bus, was great! It's also 2 blocks away from the park and the zoo, and it's a very quiet and secure neighborhood. Our room had a very practical kitchenette (2 stoves, complete cutlery, dishes, pans and pots), in which we cooked breakfast and some dinners. The greatest thing about our room was the extra long King size bed, sooooo comfortable, specially for my husband who's 6'4"! A heartfelt Mahalo to the staff, specially for the blonde lady at the reception (whose name I'm sorry to have forgotten)!!If we are ever blessed with the opportunity to return to Oahu, we will stay at the Ewa for sure!!!

If I could give this place ZERO stars, I would. This was a terrible hotel.First, the pictures online are NOT what you get. This place was an absolute dump. To summarize: - Good luck in the elevator, we were on the 7th floor and afraid it was going to break each day. - You end up paying a weird $10/day service fee that is basically for DVDs, a newspaper, the coffee in your room, etc. Even if you don't use any of this you get charged. - We thought we got an "upgrade" when they said we were in a room with a small kitchenette. This should be translated to = someone has cooked in your room and the stench will be terrible. We had to leave the windows open at all times and the smell was still there. - The bathroom sink literally fell apart (see picture) and woke us up. - No pool. - The only saving grace was the cleanliness and the fact that the hotel employees seemed to feel our pain (we told them we may check out early and they really couldn't argue and agreed).

We stayed here for 6 nights. The house cleaning did their job every night. Only complaint is an unpleasant "toilety" smell throughout the room for the first couple of days.The shuttle has an average wait time of 20-30 minutes. It is faster to take the public bus than to wait for the shuttle + wait for your turn to be dropped off.

Amazing hotel with reasonably affordable rates and accommodations. The staff is very attentive, friendly, professional, and full of Aloha. I've been to many hotels in Waikiki and this one is on my list of favorites. Great location, friendly staff, and clean rooms.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel on Holiday. The room was clear and had street view. The room was with balcony. It was not small room, I liked it.Sometime we have some problems with connection at WI-FI (it is free, but booking.com showed that it should were cost money), because hotel's routers have limit connections (we were able to connect successfully when other people were sitting on the beach :))), but in hot time - morning and evening we had problem with connection). Location is good! It close to public parking and the Waikiki beach, ZOO.I recommend this hotel!

This is not a five star hotel for sure but it is in a good location and provided good value. Waikiki in December is not cheap and we needed more than one room so had to look carefully at value rather than 'looks'. Each room was a reasonable size but cleaning standards varied and the bathroom in each was quite dated. The hotel is generally dated and looks a bit 'grubby'. Free wifi was available but was very unreliable. Staff were pleasant enough. Don't go here if looking for porters, breakfast room or modern well equipped rooms - you won't find any of that but it is in a good location and provided a reasonable place to sleep.

When I booked this hotel was looking for the cheapest I could find at last minute because our flights had changed. Wasn,t expecting much but was surprised how spacious and clean the room was. It was only basic decor but was comfortably and offered all what we needed.Location wasnt too bad and there was a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping center. Would stop there again as it offered better value for money

We booked this hotel because we had about 8 hours until our flight and it has the best reviews of the budget hotels. It was actually very quiet and we enjoyed happy hour (of our own making with our trip leftovers) on the small lanai. The front desk clerk was great and let us in an hour prior to check in. He also waived parking and resort fees since we were leaving before midnight. Definitely has been upgraded. Our unit had a kitchenette. Worth checking out if on a budget. Staff is great.

I'll preface this by saying I likely would not have picked Ewa Beach Hotel if I had been planning for a hotel vacation in Waikiki. But boy, was I glad I found it. I'd been traveling solo and spent the first two days of my trip sick in a nearby hostel when I decided it was time to just call it quits and get myself into a private room at the closest hotel I could find.I booked Ewa Beach Hotel pretty last minute via Expedia on my iPhone. The booking went smoothly and I used some travel points so it worked out to about $50 a per night. (It would've been about $125 otherwise, still the cheapest hotel in Waikiki Beach.)I had a daytime tour scheduled and I didn't want to stay at the hostel for much longer so I arrived at 8:30 am to check in and had planned to leave my baggage there before returning in the afternoon to get into a room.First things first, the front desk attendant was WONDERFUL. He wasn't just friendly and polite, as most hotel staffers usually are, he was funny, kind, and sympathetic to my situation. He checked me in, gave me my baggage check tags, and I went on my way. When I returned, it was another attendant working the front desk but he was equally as friendly. Without even checking my baggage check tag number, he already knew which bag was mine: "I had a feeling this colourful bag matched your personality."I was given a room on the top 'sundeck' floor (which wasn't much use since it had been raining all week) but it was quiet and had a decent city view. The elevator doesn't go all the way up to the eighth/sundeck floor, which I was fine with, since it was only a short walk and staircase down to the seventh floor where the elevator begins. I was fine with this, but you may not be.The room itself was a decent size and the king bed was amazing. The pillows were comfy and firm, and the duvet/comforter was fine. The room had a fridge and a coffee maker which was perfect for my snacks and treats bought from the nearby ABC Store (just around the corner). There was an A/C unit which was easily adjustable.One of the best features of the room was the XBOX which played DVDs. I usually don't spend much time in hotels but because I was sick, I made good use of the hotel's DVD rental system. It's similar to RedBox and is located in their lobby. You're given a card at check-in that you can use to get free rentals from the kiosk. What a welcome relief and change from staying in a cramped hostel.It's just two blocks from the beach, a Starbucks, a block from a couple of ABC Stores, a nail salon, countless restaurants and bars, a moped rental place, and is well enough situated in the area.As some of the other reviews note, yes, it's a dated and older hotel and there are some spots that need updates (ie. paint, carpet) but for the most part, the hotel and my room was well-maintained and in good shape. If anything, Ewa Beach Hotel was perfect for me and I'm glad I stumbled onto it. If you're not in the budget for a fancy hotel but don't want to stay in a hostel, then Ewa is probably the perfect compromise.If anything, their staff was wonderful and worth it. Thanks to the staff at Ewa Beach Hotel for being the light at the end of a challenging couple of days spent being sick and cramped in a hostel!

This is a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location. One can easily walk to all the amenities of Waikiki. There is no meal service at the hotel but decent restaurants are close by. Speedishuttle from the airport worked well in both directions. The rooms are getting tired but are clean and have the necessary features.

The breakfast was really wonderful and the attendant was very friendly,warm and courteous,this encouraged me to go for my breakfast always. I have recommended more people. Make provision for better wifi in the rooms. I really appreciate your 24 hours service and your staff very polite

I have stayed in worse places and better places. I will preface this review by saying that while my room is used primarily for sleeping and nothing else I do like it to be up to date. The hotel in general appeared to be run down. With wall paper peeling in areas and the operation of the elevator I was left with a bad taste in my mouth. I did get.my exercise by taking the stairs. It is however a block away from the sea so that was a plus. The staff was extremely friendly, understanding and accommodating. To this end I will recommend. Just remember you get what you pay for.

Location could not have been better. Parking (you paid for that) at the hotel. The price was unbelievable for what you got. It was clean, bed was comfortable and you didn't hear outside noises. When I return to Hawaii, this is where we will stay.

If you are there to surf, or enjoy the Waikiki beach, this is a good place to stay, location wise. It's only two blocks away from the mainstreet of Waikiki, where restaurants, hotels, shops are located. Meanwhile, it has its own quiteness, it's near the zoo and at the end of the busy area. My friend and i were staying in a two-beds room on the 2nd floor, decorations & furniture is kind old, but it has everything you need. One thing i need to call out, is that there's a mandatory 10+ USD per day for WIFI, tea/coffee bag and a shuttle to the big mall. So you need to add that into your daily rate when you look at the price. I spent 4 nights at the hotel, the first two nights wifi worked fine, however, i couldn't log in wifi the last two days, figured it might be too many guests were using wifi at the same time.The hotel has a small parking lot, which requires reservation & 20 bucks per day, a bit pricy i would say. The staff are fine, but there was an asian look mid-age woman, who seemed to always fail to deliver full messages. The first day i asked about parking, she said first come first serve, never mentioned about reservation, so the second day when i drove my rented car back, the hotel couldn't give you a place to park, because parking spots were fully reserved. All in all, if you are just looking for a budget hotel to just sleep with a good location, this is the one. Oh, BTW, the bed mattress is way too soft for me....

This a great little hotel for people on a budget. Close to the beach but located on a quiet side street. Rooms are super clean if a little basic. Get one with the small kitchenette and you can save a bunch of money on breakfast and lunch. Very helpful staff. Bus service is 1/2 a block away. Very close to the park, zoo and aquarium.

It's hard to rate this hotel because we had such a mixed experience. We were first assigned to Room 406 which smelled musty/smoky, looked out on a concrete block wall with ratty apartment windows in it, and had a "king size bed" made of two twins with a giant lump of foam in between that created a mountain range in the middle and had a headboard on only one side so the pillow would fall into the abyss. Actually, it had two headboards that were completely unrelated to the bed itself. After we complained we were given Room 202 which smelled fine, had a view of a palm tree and parking lot, and a nice bed. About 1/2 the staff were friendly and helpful and the other half pointedly ignored you. Now I understand why the reviews were so disparate. The location is nice for Diamond Head hike, zoo, aquarium and bus stops.

The room was basic, good enough for a budget working trip. However minor issues such as the non-responsive buttons in the lift and the lack of a channel guide for the TV could be quite irritating at times. However it is close to the tourist area at Waikeke beach so its pretty convenient to get there without the need to drive. The road can get crowded during the peak periods during dinner.

I rented a 2 bedroom at EWA Hotel for a family vacation with my two college age daughters.The hotel is close to everything, beautiful zoo, aquarium, restaurants, night clubs, shopping and a grocery store.Having a kitchenette in the room was a nice addition and convenient for having some meals in the room before heading out for the days adventures.I would definitely recommend this hotel.The only thing to be aware of is parking in the area can be pricy. It is discounted if you park at the hotel but is $20 per day.The staff was helpful and pointed us in the right direction of sites not to be missed.One of them being Valley of the Temples! A must see.

Having a young child it was very nice to have such a budget hotel so close to the beach. The hotel itself is very visually nice on the outside, the rooms could definitely use a slight upgrade. The staff was also great and did not mind all the beach we would bring back with us from our day out. We did get a room with a kitchenette that was also a plus because Hawaii as we all know is very pricey!

2 blocks from beach easy parking room was good was upgraded to kitchen room never used kitchen as was on holiday price great no problems was on first floor and out of car in room in 5 minutes....would stay again

I love The Ewa Hotel so much I am coming back in January 2016 for my 49th Birthday and my Friends 55th Birthday and we are staying for 10 days and I would not stay any where else. The Staff at the Ewa Hotel is the best.

This property offers an excellent value in a convenient location to the beach, zoo, shopping & dining. The pillow top beds are incredibly comfortable and the front desk staff are exceptionally warm and caring. Many thanks to "Dylan" for her Aloha hospitality!

This hotel is located within 2 mins walk to beach and the Waikiki Zoo and set amongst high class piers such the The Marriot, Hyatt, Ashton, and Queen Kapiolani however at probably less than half the price tag. So not only is the location so convenient but also very quiet. The hotel looks very plain and unassuming and is only rated 2 stars but the staff are very helpful and available 24hrs. The rooms are very clean and the beds super comfortable. Air conditioning is both quiet and effective. Wake up service is reliable whilst beds are made and towels changed daily. What more could you ask for?

I never want to stay at this hotel again. I have to pay daily $20 for parking, and around $11 for convenience fee beside what I already paid when I booked this hotel. The hotel is too old, physical condition is poor. It needs to be torn down and rebuild. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

The hotel was a block off the beach, and within walking distance to the zoo, aquarium and most other points of interest. The rooms were simple, but you don't need much when you're never in the room. Looked like they were undergoing a revamp, but for anyone on a budget this is a great place to check out.

We stayed here for 6 nights, stayed in room # 312 with 2 king size beds, kitchenette had microwave, sink, fridge, free wifi, and playstation.Bear in mind, you get for what you pay for, for a rated 2 star hotel i'll say its probarly worth every penny, but no more than that, since its the summer peak season, friendly check in by "PT" gave us some info about the resort fee, there is a extra charge pr day for that $ 10.47 mandatory, towels, complimentary coffee, wifi, and free shuttle service to Ala Moana Center etc. Let me start by saying that the wifi really sucked big time, the worse was in the evening couldnt log on almost every night, but once on really slow OMG.waikiki beach was only a block away, and ABC store was also just around the corner thumbs up for the property for that.The maids at the hotel is super friendly, and gave extra aminities when u asked them nicely :-)2 blocks away some good dinner places, move away from the touristic places its a trap.Was able to have a later check out, coz of a night flight, fantastic service thx alot "PT" Wont mind coming here again, when the opportunity arises MAHALO.

I got a room through hotwire.com, there is one slow elevator, limited parking, our room did not have towels, I had a view of the storage room through my "city view" window, and there were critters in the bathroom. To be fair, I had a heart to heart with the night staff and they changed my room to something much better-- it was still "aged" but better than my initial experience. It's close to the beach, it's convenient and affordable. That's about it.

Hotel staff was nice but hotel physically was very poor. Corridors were old and dated, beds were small, entire property smelled of smoke. Price was decent (not great) and location isn't central (though isn't horrible).

I called ahead for a couple of special requests and Ryan was very kind and made sure my requests were noted. Front desk staff was awesome.The room was very clean and comfortable. Near Waikiki Beach, Restaurants, Hawaiian Cultural places and plenty of shoppingMahalo nui...!

My sister and I stayed here last year for one week. It was a great place to stay within walking distance to the Waikiki beach. There is a ABC store downstairs that sells you anything you need. Restaurants are all over the place. Everything is so close by, you could just walk anywhere. This hotel may not be luxurious, but it has a comfortable bed and the basic things to meet your needs. There is no elevators. There's only one ice machine located on the first floor, but that doesn't bother me so much. I would definitely stay here again.

Sarah Ann Lee S
Chico, California, United States

review_body: Before booking this we were a bit dicey reading other reviews here. We were on a little budget, but the pictures looked fine so we booked it. We got a good deal from another website.When we got here the girl at the reception was very friendly. We got a free upgrade to the big suite on the top floor that had a kitchenette. The room is quaint and clean. Not a five star hotel with great luxuries, but the essentials were there. Besides, who wants to stay in the room in Hawaii anyways.The rooms don't have a great view since it's hotels all around it, but honestly the beach is a minute and half away. There are ABC store, Starbucks, restaurants, all a stones throw away. The hotel location is really great without you having to shell out a great deal. Plus the hotel also has a rooftop sun deck with tanning beds and chairs and tables.The staff is very very helpful and humble. They don't speak English much but they are damn polite.There is a 10$ service fee for every day of your stay but that includes Wi-Fi, DVDnow access, etc. We rented out for movies during our stay.All in all, I'd say we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Good budget hotel, staff friendly and helpful. Hotel location is fantastic for Waikiki beach and shops etc. rooms clean and tidy but need updating and a little TLC, but otherwise comfortable.Near zoo and transport which is always a plus.

we stayed here early December 2014 for 2 nights. It is not the 'flashest' hotel but the staff were nice and helpful. The hotel is in the quieter side of Honolulu and only a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and there are lot of places to eat at that are within walking distance. The rooms were 'moderately' clean and the beds were comfortable but the wifi was not very strong at times. There is a resort fee you pay per night and shuttle service to Ala Moana Mall is included in this resort fee which is nice. Overall, I would stay here again.

Staff nice, room sufficient (except no kettle), bed comfy, view average, wifi intermittent if you can get it to work in the first place, no welcome water in the room which would be nice after travelling for 25 hours, situated far end of Waikiki from airport, lift/elevator slow and jumpy, no pool, close-ish to beach and front street (5 mins walk), that's all I can say as only stayed one night...... Would stay somewhere else if returned to Waikiki.

It was a.great hotel to.stay in staff all around very friendly an the.hotel was very clean wish they had continental breakfast but stores were a few mins away walking distance especially the beach.Loved our trip will stay again next trip around.

This place was excellent! First, the location can't be beat. Two short blocks to Waikiki Beach and about two miles to Diamond Head (we just walked, but you can catch a city bus.) Due to jet lag, I was up at 5:00 a.m. almost every day and the maintenance staff was already out taking care of the exterior. The cleaning staff seemed to be there 24/7. I don't remember ever walking through the hallway to our room and not seeing one of them. Try as we did, we could not keep the mounds of sand that accumulated in our bathing suits off the floor. Somehow, they actually managed to get it all up. Additionally, everyone is super-friendly. The desk staff was professional, courteous and very helpful. They helped us with bus schedules, suggestions for waterfall hikes, and inexpensive restaurant recommendations. Yes, the rooms are small and not equipped with the latest steamshower/spa tub/french press coffee maker, but who cares? You're in Hawaii! Get out of your room and go do something! Anything!

Only about two short blocks from the beach, within steps of the zoo and Kapiolani Park, and situated on a fairly quiet side street, it's hard to beat the location. Additionally, all staff members I encountered (front desk, security, housekeeping, maintenance) were helpful and friendly. Room was clean (though the hallway carpet needed cleaning), bed comfortable, and the "convenience fee", which I hate, was fairly modest and included the use of the room safe as well as first run movies. Kitchenette was adequately appointed.

I feel context is king. It all depends on what you're used to and what you're willing to both tolerate and pay for. For me, I've stayed at bed stained rooms where you didn't dare take off your footwear even in the tub in Hong Kong, gangster ridden love hotels in Japan where you can touch both walls with outstretched arms and the rural countryside of China where they sweep the freeway with a straw broom while cars zoom by. I draw the line at bugs and pests that are hard to see, simply because they can latch on and be brought home. That's what I saw and that's why I left. Immediately. Again context. There is no need for this. There are other comparable hotels that share close proximity to the beach, are roughly in the same price range and are both clean and pest free. Sure they're older but I've stayed at them and know first hand. As for me, like many others, I left after one night and spent a wonderful vacation elsewhere.

One of the less expensive places to stay in Waikiki. It is close to the main street, shopping area and beach. I was only there for one night and it was fine for that purpose. Couldn't contact reception when I had a problem with the shower when I arrived, but the man on reception in the morning was very helpful.

This is one of the older properties on Waikiki, situated on the Kapi'olani Park side (near the Zoo). It is not on the ocean so there are no views, and not all rooms have lanais (ironically, the ones that do face away from the beach). The lobby is tiny and the hallway carpets are badly in need of refurbishment. However, the double room we stayed at was perfectly clean and comfortable, though the largely fluorescent lighting was ugly and there were not enough electrical outlets for our devices. The Ewa used to nickel and dime you for all sorts of services--these have now been combined into a $10 per day "convenience" fee, which is an improvement of sorts. Although the establishment claims to have on-site parking ($20 a day) it is limited to a dozen spaces and they tend to sell out--be warned that you may be sent to the nearby Aston Banyan garage (same price, much bigger), or the Zoo parking lot. Wireless internet was free but tended to log you off at the slightest pretext, necessitating repeated re-entry, an annoyance. I really disliked the fact that there was only one elevator, old and rickety. In short, the main reason to stay here is the price, which is still a good deal--who comes to Hawai'i to sit in a hotel?

We wanted a room for a few nights at the Queen Kapiolani and when we called reservations they sent us to their partner hotel saying it was comparable. Not even close! I was horrified at the old and filthy condition! I was very sick when we arrived and thought that the sheets looked slept in! When I finally felt better and got up the next day I pulled the bedding back and saw a huge STAIN ON THE SHEETS! I could not get out of there fast enough! I called the reservations line and they basically told me I was out of luck to move hotels. When I called the front desk they told me that the manager was not onsite and that they would get ahold of her. Once I explained what I had found and the condition of this very old and filthy run down hotel she offered to find us a room at the "Queen" for a night as I told her I would be RUNNING out of the hotel! She never came to see the room but said that she would send the head of housekeeping. I would never have even checked in but for the fact it was nearing midnight and I was very ill with a migraine:( The manager did refund us our "resort" fees that we knew nothing about until checking in, which by the way, were for the internet that did not work, and she also refunded $40 additional on our account. I have been coming to Oahu for 25 years and I usually do not stray from Marriott properties but we tried to be budget conscience before going out to Ko Olina. I literally ran down and across the Marriott and told them the situation. By this time I was a little hysterical and felt my skin crawling. The Marriott took us in at a wonderful last minute rate and we could not get out of the Ewa fast enough! To the Managers credit she did find us a room at the "Queen" but we obviously turned it down. I have never experienced anything like this and it still gives me nightmares! The pics I have not posted are the ones where the wallpaper is coming off of the walls, the gross, dirty carpet, absolutely gross microwave w/dried food all over the inside as well as the "stove area" that was so dirty its beyond description:(

Well what a place. What more can we say. Local fair stuff. Get a plate dinner off menus. Many years ago iused to get the avocado sandwich but not certain if they have that now. The cocktails were once worth it.

Close to the Waikiki beach and zoo. Parking lot at site (for 20 $/day, and can be full at night), working internet, but not too clean bathroom (we found some soap from previous guests). Anyway, the lowest price on the coast. A bit windy at the top floors.

Steps away from Kalakaua and Kuhio Beach, it is peaceful and quiet, away from the traffic noise. Ewa hotel is actually located right behind Aston Waikiki and we used it because Aston could not guarantee us late check-out. It is half-price from what Aston offers, and we got exactly what we paid for. Modest studio room with two twin beds and a couch in the corner, no balcony, motel style bathroom with kitchenette squeezed into the sink atrium. Kitchenette's stove top and few pots and pans allowed us freedom of home-made dinner: I was longing to try and cook some local fare healthy style. Food Pantry grocery store is within 10-15 minutes walk, and every bus and trolley goes that direction. Hotel building is 5 or 6 stories high, with old fashioned elevator(s), some rooms have balconies. It has everything, that some big hotels don't offer: free Wi-Fi, less expensive parking, cab service by the front desk, minimal resort fees. It is a real gem of hospitality, cleanliness and care for your comforts.

This hotel needs a 3 1/2 rating at most, but we're being kind. It is within walking distance of the east end of Waikiki Beach, which is the best thing about it. The next best thing is the price. We just needed somewhere to stay for 2 nights before we headed to the north shore of Oahu for the rest of our trip and didn't want to spend a lot of money. The price was decent even after you add the $20 per day for parking and the $10 resort fee. Parking was crazy in Honolulu so we were actually glad for it and to our surprise we always found a parking spot here. They said we got a free upgrade from the "moderate room" we had reserved. It was a 2 double bed room with a tiny kitchenette. The beds were so small that we utilized the 2nd bed on our 2nd night because we couldn't roll over without waking each other up (we're used to our king at home). The furnishings are pretty tired. There was a nice large flat screen TV that we never even turned on. The bathroom was tiny. We had a small balcony overlooking the street below and building next door. There was a safe, microwave, fridge and even a 2 burner stove. The plates, cups, bowls, and utensils were in the closet. The A/C worked. The elevator really is jerky and clunky, but we didn't die. The staff was very nice and kept our luggage while we went snorkeling. They were supposed to wait until noon to clean our room because we were trying to come back and shower, but when we got there at 10:45 the maids were just finishing up our room, so we didn't want to mess it up again. Great plan, poor execution. By the way, we got to Hanauma Bay before 7 am and when we left around 10:15, the parking lot was full. Go early! We felt safe at the Ewa. They seem to have decent security. All the hostels are close, but it was fairly quiet.

This hotel is definitely well passed its prime. As soon as we got passed the lobby into the elevator it was all downhill, actually amazed the elevator even passes safety inspections it is so jerky and clunky. All carpets are stained and dirty, walls are chipped and peeling, depressing common areas. Bathroom in our room was gross, peeling paint, mildew, stained and corroded fixtures. We didn't even want to check in but couldn't find any other affordable hotels at 5pm on a Saturday evening so decided to tough it out. The linens on the bed were so chemically smelling and stiff it was a very uncomfortable nights sleep and when I woke up in the morning I had hives all over my face and neck and my eyes were almost swollen shut, I thought at first that maybe it was too much sun but after waking up even worse the next morning I figured out it was either the linens or maybe they had sprayed bedbug killer on the pillows and mattresses.There was a dumpster parked in the hotel driveway that was constantly getting mattresses and box springs thrown into it from the hotel (bedbugs?)I complained to the front desk about the horrible allergic reaction and that I thought it was from the sheets, their reply was to offer me a roll of quarters so I could wash the bedding myself in the guests laundry room.I had to go to a clinic and get steroids the reaction got so bad, needless to say my vacation was pretty much ruined as I couldn't go outside in the sun.The only redeeming thing about the hotel is the location and the staff were all very pleasant.We had finally had enough after the 4th night and checked into the Courtyard Marriott.Now I'm crossing my fingers we didn't bring any hitchhiking bedbugs home with us:(This hotel was worse than many third world backpacking hostels I've stayed in, wouldn't recommend to anyone.

This was a good basic hotel with spacious rooms. We had trouble with drunks the first night of our stay but otherwise there were no problems. The room was serviced everyday except for Thanksgiving and staff were pleasant and polite.

The great: hotel location is perfect, 30 yards off the a main street so two minutes by foot to beaches, Starbucks, zoo, restos and bars, but quiet at night. Hotel staff was always friendly, helpful and kind; they get five stars for sure. Hotel parking is at lobby level so super easy access and only 10 seconds and you are in your room. Cost is $20 per day and includes in and out privileges. This is a MAJOR plus as most hotels in the area are valet so you have to wait around and tip every time you need your car. That said, if you just want to go to the beach and eat and drink, you do not need a car here. Room had coffee maker (with drip coffee refills provided daily and small refrigerator).The bad: The hotel is in dire need of a make-over. My best guess is that every thing is original from circa 1970.The ugly: The beds were extremely uncomfortable, but were probably great in 1970. We stayed a week and my travel partner and I both had awful backaches the whole time [and we have traveled all through several developing nations but these beds were the worst.]With some renovations, this hotel would be lovely.

Stayed 4 nights at Ewa Hotel recently. It has a good location in Waikiki and closed to the public bus stops.This is an old hotel which I didn't mind given that this is one of the better deals in Waikiki. However, I was bitten by bed bugs when I stayed here. There were small cockroaches in the bathroom in the middle of the night. This really irks me a lot which I found it to be absolutely disgusting. The front desk staffs were relatively professional. Housekeeping however needs to improve as I found the same rubbish that was never cleaned during the 4 nights I was there.Beware.

We had a couple of days to explore Honolulu before we boarded a cruiseship so wanted a central inexpensive hotel. My husband and I travelled with our 3 teenagers and his mother. We wanted to spend most of our time away and just needed a clean and comfortable place to sleep. This was perfect for our group of 6 due to the connecting rooms and the twin bed availability. We got a 2 bdr. suite which included 4 twin beds, 1 queen and a small kitchenette. It was very small (think college dorms), but clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was very helpful. It served its purpose well.

This is a perfect place if you are looking for just a super comfy bed in which to sleep. What it lacks in amenities it makes up for in convenience and affordability. Located half a block from Waikiki beach, the hotel is within walking distance of multiple attractions which suits our lifestyle perfectly. We don't need a fancy resort with spas and restaurants, just a good night's sleep and directions to great food. I would book this place again if we came back in the future.

In walking distance to the ocean and shops. We found the price very reasonable. Hotel is older but clean and staff was very friendly. I would strongly recommend for anyone looking for a nice hotel at a decent price with a great location!

Just wanted to say a special thanks you to guest services at the Ewa Hotel. The service I received there is unparalleled and thanks to Dylan, her professionalism and expertise has made an significant impact in assisting me to accomplish the things I needed. This a true testament of her commitment to customer service and satisfaction. Thank you again for everything.

We arrived to the hotel over an hour before the check in,the receptionist make us wait until 3pm.The room was very comfortable,nice balcony,good table,good bed,coffee machine,little fridge and very big bathroom.The location is excellent,the staff helpful.The parking lot was kind of expensive per night.We will go back again.

Needed a place to stay between arrival of flight and boarding ship, nights of October 2-3, 2014. We would stay here again. Clean,plain, comfortable bed. It had a sink and a couple of burners and a microwave in the "kitchenette" and a refrigerator - look in the closet for utensils. Tiny but sufficient-for-2 dining table. Flat screen TV. View of Diamond Head from our balcony. 6th or 7th floor (can't remember). Surprisingly quiet.The elevator was extremely pokey. Wi-Fi is free but iffy. Desk personnel very helpful. Tours don't pick up at hotel, but about 2 blocks from pickup stop, 3 (?) blocks from Waikiki Beach and about the same distance from Starbucks. Very near the zoo, and about 2 blocks from the ubiquitous ABC store. Buy a float or tube from the ABC (about $4) and enjoy Waikiki Beach - at this point it is contained by a low sea wall so you don't float out to sea or worry about rip tides. Not good for surfing though.

Very good, friendly staff and very close to the beach. There was no restaurant and no breakfast, but there vere lots of places nnear by. We loved it. It was also close to the zoo and to other attractions. Also close to nice shops and frirndly touristshops where we could find omtrressting things, not only the usual tourist stuff.

We stayed at the EWA Hotel from Oct 24th to Nov 7th, 2014! Our room was on the 6th floor we booked a room with a kitchenette which was perfect cause we bought a few groceries and made our breakfast every morning. This hotel is by no means anything fancy but it's clean, quiet, and i thought the location was perfect for the price. You are maybe a one or two mins walk from Waikiki beach! They cleaned our room every day! The Shower has excellent water pressure...you hotta have great water pressure :) The Wi-Fi is not free but when i was on my room patio i could actually log unto to the EWA lobby Wi-Fi.... or you can go down and sit in the lobby and surf the net there! If you want to book any tours, this hotel doesn't really offer information or book tours for you...however up the street at the Queen Kapiolani hotel, they have all the tour information, pamphlets and will even book tours for you...we booked two tours this way and we got picked up in front of the Queen Kapiolani which again is maybe a one minute walk away from the EWA!! Again it's in a great location, up the street is a Wolfgang Puck express restaurant loved that place, food was sooo good, ate there a few times! There are ABC stores close by where we got our groceries etc... there's a Starbucks, Subway...everything is just mins away and I'm talking one or two mins walk not 10!! I'm more than happy with my choice because I personally think staying in a beachfront hotel would be too noisy at night not to mention pricy given it's Waikiki beach. If I ever make it back to Hawaii and stayed on Oahu Island I'd book the EWA without hesitation!

I forgot something in this hotel and called them asking if they could send me them. They confirmed they found the items that I had forgotten and promised to ship them to me. Since nothing arrived after 10 days, I called them again. They apologized and promised that they would expedite the shipping. However, it's been more than to weeks since then and I haven't received anything. Of course, it was made clear from the very beginning that I would bear shipping costs and I gave them my card number.Bottom line, very poor customer service. As long as they need to take your money and get some profit, they are OK, otherwise they just don't care.

We stayed here last Oct 14 and so far it was great. Location and room wise.Very convenient the only disadvantage was the parking and the wifi both we have to pay for it.Staff were very efficient and helpful.Overall stay was great. Keep up the good work will recommend this hotel to some friends.

We usually stay at a certain hotel on the strip but, it was not available so for the lower price of this one it was just as nice because the other one needs a facelift because it is getting old. This one has new furniture so that was nice. Our room was spacious enough for three people there were two small beds and a sofa bed that was adequate. The bathroom was not very clean when we got in there was hair on the door and the worn out dingy bathtub and shower massager was not really up to par but, there was always hot water and for the price of the room for all three of us can't really complain about that. The lady was very helpful when we made our reservations and very friendly too. It is located near the zoo and on a one way alley street which is nice because we are not partiers and don't need to be right on the strip. It was nice and quiet. The only real problem I had with our stay is that there is not enough parking which is $20 a night by the way. One night we asked to get parking and were told twice on the phone that there was not parking. When we got back tot he hotel we went to the parking garage and there was SUV parked in the one handicapped space. It however did not have a handicapped sticker so I went inside to ask about it since we do have one. The guy at the desk said that it was one of the employees that he sometimes parks there when he is a work. He said he didn't know anything about why we were told we had to park elsewhere at another hotel and walk 2 blocks back to our hotel. He was apologetic but, never made the employee move his car. I took photos of the SUV and the fact that he had no handicap parking. I think that the employees should be made to park elsewhere since there are limited number of spaces and not even enough for all the hotel guests as it is. This is a concern that I will have to consider for my stay in Waikiki in the near future.

Checked in last minute when reservation at a different hotel fell through. Upon attempting to check in at other hotel I was told rudely that there was no room matching the reservation I originally made. The only room available was 600$ more. So when I called Ewa to get a last minute room for 4 people and 8 days they were very accommodating. Prompt courteous service. Presented with upfront fees that I found fair. In room wifi was not great but ok. Clean and stocked rooms with friendly staff that came same time every day. Had a problem with DVD player that was taken care of right away. Amazing sun deck. Clean laundry faculties. Superb location. Close to zoo,restataunts, aquarium, bus stops, ABC stores and Kuhio beach park. Very welcomed experience for our first family vacation in Hawaii. Will definitely stay again.

I admit it, I took a gamble on this hotel and unfortunately it did not pay off. We were greeted by a miserable guy and then we had to haul our luggage up the stairs because the hotel were moving furniture - so they were using the lift. We got put in the smallest room I think I have ever stayed in, it was not only the size of a shoebox but the walls were also as thin as cardboard - i could hear every conversation next door clear as day - which made it impossible to sleep. There was also a "disturbance" that night a few rooms up from us which required the police to turn up and sort out. The room was poorly maintained and literally falling apart. The lady on the desk that night had no idea about local phone numbers or the free shuttle that goes through town - her response was "maybe just ask someone on the street" - seriously? The only good thing about this hotel was that i got my money back for the nights i did not end staying there + the lady at the front desk apologised when we checked out.

this hotel has really good staff, good location with beach front, 10 min walk from metro.as soon as you go out side door taxi is ready to take you places.clean rooms , bath tub, nice roof top swimming pool.food in hotel is so nicely cooked, situated in the heart of town with all shops around.free wifi, good size TV,no disco and out side sound don't disturb your sleep .i would give this hotel good 10 out of 10 for the money and services i got .

Pros: Location is 5 minute walk to beach; lands right in between busy and safe Waikiki beach and quiet, open beach. Rooms are big enough. Nice rooftop deck with partial ocean view. Across from the zoo and park. Cons: they never cleaned my room the five days I was there despite putting up the little sign saying "please clean". Small lanais. Room views are terrible. Next door to sketchy hostel. They charge a $10 per day "convenience fee" for things that should be included such as wifi and coffee (fee is not optional). In room wifi is terrible. Rooms not fancy by any means and a little dated.I'd still recommend this place for the price and the location. It serves it's purpose.

I liken finding accommodation in Honolulu to finding it in New York. There are so many hotels how do you choose?I knew of the Aqua brand (this is Aqua Lite) and wanted to spend more money doing things than wasting it on a hotel room I would only sleep in. So this one fit the bill perfectly.I stayed here twice in eight days in two different but identical rooms, both one bedroom kitchenette suites.Yes the decor is from a time when Magnum PI roamed the streets in his red Ferrari, but what do you expect for a budget price?I was pleasantly surprised to find I had a balcony with a table and chairs to enjoy the balmy breezes.Located at the southern end of Waikiki Beach and only two blocks away from Kalakaua Avenue, which is the main vein in Honolulu.Having the kitchenette is a nice bonus as it can be expensive eating every meal out, so hit the convenience store, stock up on goodies - especially all the fresh pineapple you can eat - and do Honolulu in style with the money saved on your hotel.I recommend this hotel for a budget holiday in Honolulu.

The hotel is well situated at the end of Waikiki beach, it is close to some good restaurants and is clean and good value. However the decor and the furniture need updating, which is happening presently. A deal is offered upon arrival to receive free WiFi, newspaper, DVD's, no surcharge on local calls, this will add $10 a day and the WiFi is slow. All the staff are very helpful, even if some staff find it difficult to understand you.

Slightly older hotel about 2 minutes walk to prime downtown Waikiki beach. Big rooms are bright, airy and clean and have kitchenette to help keep down meal cost-s and thus represent good value. Looks like management is currently replacing old furniture with new and bed was nice and firm. Hotel location relatively quiet, nice lobby and front garden while waiting for tours and partial views to ocean from the accessible rooftop which is a bonus. Staff friendly and helpful but internet access is extra $10 day :{. Go to high floors of 5 & 6 for views over low rise flats in front and to help minimise street noise. Also avoid rooms 14 & 15 at and of corridors next to noisy elevator. Some rooms also have internal door connections to adjacent rooms that leak noise thru.

On August 9, in late evening I arrived (took me about half an hour to find the hotel) to checkin and then out again to, (a) look for something to eat, and, (b) find a parking. When I returned to my room (304) I found out that the aircon has been dripping and the carpet was soaking wet. Since it was late, I did not want to bother to call the front desk. The following day, Sunday, August 10, I called and someone came to fix the aircon at around nine-ish which was irritating because of the noise. This raise an interesting question. Why didn't the housekeeping inform the front desk of the dripping aircon (found two trash cans underneath the aircon to catch water). The hotel has limited parking and they charge $20 per night although the front desk said he could give me a discount. On August 13, I went back to pick up my luggages that I stored at the hotel and the front desk clerk was visibly uncooperative. He just brought my two luggages to an area by the elevator and said, "There go and get your luggage." I was holding a $5 bill that I wanted to give him as a tip, but decided not to since he was rude and uncooperative. Would I stay at the hotel again? Maybe, if there is parking. Is the hotel worth its daily rate? I don't think so.

We only stayed in Waikiki one-night before heading off to our rental condo and thought the EWA was perfect! Things I liked: Really close to the beach - like two short blocks, close to Diamond Head, close to the zoo, close to the Waikiki Shell, close to an ABC store (but what isn't), little kitchenette in the room, functioning lanai, easy to get to from H1. Managed to get the last spot in their very small parking garage (first-come, first-serve). Clean and quiet when we were there. Staff was very-efficient and polite.

Because this is a block off Kuhio street it is much quieter at night. It is absolutely clean and comfortable, with just about the best pillows I ever encountered outside of home! It's at the zoo end of Waikiki and the price is really excellent. There is a little fridge and a microwave. I had a disabled accessible room with a large bathroom. All excellent. five stars.

It was a business trip (took part in a conference together with my spouse) so we were looking for a hotel to spend there only night hours. Unfortunately, our travelling budget was not grate, so when we found EWA Hotel for such a nice price we were really glad. What we adored in this hotel:1. Location. Near Waikiki beach (3 minutes walk), bus stop to every place you want on Oahu in 1 minute walk, a lot of shops and restaurants in pedestrian acces. 2. Room was comfortable, everything a traveller need (if your aim is to walk aroand, not siting in hotel)3. Very friendly and helpful stuff (free lemon water in the entrance hall was perfect) The only thing I wish to be improved is WiFi connection:really poor. But you have MacD in 3 minutes walk.;) So I really recomend this nice hotel for unfussy travellers! p.s. Waikiki on this side is much calmer and less crowded

Great to have a budget alternative in pricey Waikiki. The staff were very friendly & helpful. The room was basic, but comfortable and met our needs. Wifi should be free. If Asia can do it, so can USA.

We recently spent 2 nights at Ewa Hotel and we will NEVER return. To begin with, the room smelt. Like years and years of smoking that no amount of deodorizer could disguise. The "king" bed was two singles pushed together that would separate throughout the night. The air-conditioner would randomly switch off which made for a hot, uncomfortable sleep. We booked this place based on some of the good reviews we had seen on here however we we're sorely disappointed. The service was also below average. We had a misunderstanding with the wrong credit card being charged (we had asked for a different card to be used on check in) however when we went down to discuss it the guy on the desk couldn't care less and I was made to feel as though it was my mistake.. His words "what do you want me to do, give you a refund and charge the other card?". HE WAS SO RUDE!! For the price, we weren't expecting luxury however we have stayed at cheaper places on this trip that we're FAR better. We definitely won't return.

I must say I was pleasantly surprised by the value and service we received. We were staying in Waikiki for a function over the weekend and said, "we'll just stay in a cheap flea bag since we will only be there to sleep". Our experience couldn't have been further from that statement. When I arrived the gentleman at the front desk was extremely courteous and helpful. I needed parking but the hotel lot was sold out (they have a very small lot) but he provided me with detailed info on parking at another property near and at the zoo which was less than a block away. In the end he went out of his way to get me parking right there at the hotel. This is an older hotel but all of the rooms have been renovated and updated. They rooms are very clean and well maintained. The air conditioner appeared to be new worked great which is a big plus to us. There are only two minor negative comments I have to make are the lack of parking on property and the noise level on the front side of the hotel in the morning when people are checking out out (in the hotel's defense this is in any short rise hotel in Waikiki). We will stay here again and recommend it to anyone we know looking for a room in this price range.

I would like to start by saying that the line "you get what you pay for" does not apply here. I paid the same for a different hotel in Waikiki last year, and had a great experience. I made the mistake of wanting to try something new here...We booked 4 rooms. Two of them had kitchens. They cost the same, and I was expecting them to be the same. They were not. One had a big window/door that opened to a balcony, and the other looked like a dungeon. The window looked like what I imagine to be a prison window. It was dark and very very smelly. But do not think the other room with kitchen was a lot better. The toilet was clogged. And after they came to fix it, it was not fixed, and we were told... nothing, just that it was not "totally" fixed. When I asked where I could hang my clothes, they told me to use the closet... but there wasn't one! And the floor had random spots that were wet. Plain wet that your feet could feel it. When we complained about all of it, they said they had no rooms available to switched us. So we changed hotels. And I sometimes read reviews of people who have to change hotels on the day they arrive, and I wondered how they could do this. Now I know: a lot of will to scape hell. Even after flying from MI and GA to HI, we still had the energy to leave this place. Of course it was not simple. The people at the desk were less than helpful. For example, they just started a conversation on the phone when I was in the middle of a sentence. Finally they agreed to refund us the WHOLE reservation if we leave by 9 pm. And we were more than ready to do so, so we left. But then when it was time to see our refund, we had to again call Expedia 3 more times to get the first day refunded. So it could have been a nightmare, but we ended up at the Hilton (Prince Kuhio), so I quickly forgot about all this trouble. I did think you all should know about this place.

I have stayed twice here and was perfect. The rooms are clean roomy very comfortable bed. Most/many rooms have a kitchenette. The price is reasonable. The location is great. Is at the quiet east/Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Just steps from great beaches,Kapiolani Park and the zoo. The staff very nice. I like the location for going for a walk and going to the quieter beaches right there

A friend arrived at reception around 10am after a 9 hour flight (sleepless) to check in. She was crying, extremely tired and desperate for a place to sleep. Nevertheless she told there is no chance to check in until 3pm that day and she couldn't wait in lobby, there was "nothing we can do".While I understand Ewa have policy they work to, surely they could have done something!

Hotel was local to the beach, stores, buses, and major attractions. Beds were very comfortable. It is a no frills hotel, but hey how long do you spend in the room when in Hawaii. Hotel staff were very friendly.

this was a great last minute find hotel, the hotel it self is small but served its purpose. the room was average size and the bed was super comfy. our room was located on the roof top so we had a great view. front des was very helpful and knowledgeable. room was very clean.

It was a pleasant stay at Ewa Hotel because the location is quite favorable. Plus the rooms are large enough, though a bit old, but I am not complaining. The service was good, considering easy check-in and check-out procedures. Basically, for a reasonable price, and knowing I would be out most of the day, this hotel is worth checking out.

What can I say about the Ewa Hotel? It was absolutely amazing!!! Found the hotel on a whim and extremely last minute. I was visiting the island to see my boyfriend who is stationed there. Our other hotel that we had booked fell through and I was intent on finding a new one. The Ewa hotel was within our budget and time line. The hospitality made me feel as though I was staying with family. John especially was extremely helpful, even offering a few recommended locations considering it was my first time to Oahu. The hotel is older yes but does not lack luster. The rooms are spacious and very clean. PERFECT location, a block from the beach and within walking distance to pretty much anywhere else you want to go in Waikiki. I will most difinitely be staying there the next time I am on the island. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

This is not your 5 star hotel. BUT for the price, service, and location - you can not ask for more! The hotel is clean and beds are super comfortable! Service is exceptional! Stayed for 10 days and couldn't of been any more pleased. Its a short walk to all the shops and restaurants. Very close to the beach and parking is much cheaper here then anywhere else!

My friends and I stayed at this hotel for our spring break trip in Honolulu. The room we were originally checked in was decent but old. There were bugs in the room and our toilet ended up cracking. The maintenance man that looked into our broken toilet was incredibly nice and friendly; also, he was able to move us into another room. At the front desk, they ended up upgrading us to a 1 bedroom suite which was amazing. Everyone at the hotel provided outstanding service but Etsu and Brandon were the two front desk agents who really went above and beyond with helping us. The location of the hotel was very ideal also.

To be fair this was our last stop on the way home from a 6 week holiday and I have to say I was totally disappointed. the photos did not represent what the room was like. The lobby was beautiful but the room was not maintained very well. the whole room was outdated and in bad repair. we complained but no other rooms were available. whilst we were complaining several other couples were also complaining about the same thing. the only pro is the location. wouldnt stay there again

This is a small hotel at the far end of the touristic strip in Waikiki, one block from the zoo. The hotel itself is modest and non pretentious, but if you are on a budget and want to be conveniently located for the attractions, shopping and the beach, this is it.You can take the bus from the airport and it will drop you one block from the hotel in Kuhoi. If you want to save in food, the rooms (not sure if all) have kitchenettes, you can buy groceries in the Food Pantry a few blocks on Kuhoi. There's also ABC convenience stores everywhere, but the Food Pantry is a full supermarket.Staff were prompt at attending to a problem in our room.

Me, my husband and 5 other members of our family stayed here,,,it was reasonably priced,,, within walking distance to Waikiki Beach, shopping and restaurants,,,the staff from the front desk employees to the cleaning people were extremely friendly and did everything they could to make sure our visit was an enjoyable one,,,it may not be a real fancy hotel but their rooms were clean and their beds were super comfortable,,,and the service was great!!

We have been to Waikiki many times, stayed at many hotels but if you want service with a smile from genuinely nice people then you must stay here.Most Hawaiian people are friendly and polite but the guys at EWA are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble, during our stay we celebrated my wife's birthday and our wedding anniversary and Etsu, Brandon and John on the front desk made sure we had a great time staying with them.We had a room with a small kitchenette, very useful especially for long stays if you do not want to eat out constantly, we also had a lanai that afforded us views of Diamond Head. EWA is in a quiet road, neighbouring hotels front onto Kuhio which is noisy at the best of times, Cartwright is the opposite. The EWA is a small to medium size, low rise hotel, it has everything you need and is only a few hundred yards from the beach.There is a programme of improvement currently under way but I doubt that It will take away the character of the hotel, we have stayed here 3 times now and will keep coming back, EWA strikes the right balance of comfort, convenience and affordability that we look for in a Hawaiian hotel and perhaps just as important, to us at least, when you check in here you know you are back in a Hawaii.

The Ewa Hotel is a very comfortable hotel which is affordable and service at the 'Front Desk' is the first glimpse of the hospitality and enjoyment to follow with efficiency being at the top of my list.I arrived here after feeling quite tired after a long day and was very surprised to find the hotel so conveniently located as it was less than a 15 minute trip from the central Bus station.I slept soundly in the firm, yet comfortable beds and the room was tastefully decorated.The Buffet was opened at 7 in the morning and being in the restaurant downstairs by the reception was convenient for checkout as the service was polite and I felt at home which is really a positive factor.I could use my laptop while I waited for breakfast and have had a very enjoyable stay so I shall recommend this hotel as it is really lovely.The room was clean, the bathroom clean and the whole ambience very pleasant indeed.

We went to Hawaii for the first time for our anniversary. We had a relative recommend this hotel and at first we were skeptical because of the price but we are so happy we tried it! The staff are very friendly, they upgraded our room without us asking which was great! It was a big room, with a kitchenette, flat screen tv, two full beds, couch, etc. We were on the 6th floor and used the washer and dryer just across the hall. The air conditioning was new and worked great, came with a remote control. We walked 3 min down to the Waikiki beach and watched the sunset. There's tons of restaurants and shops, we could walk everywhere including the International Marketplace. Our only complaint was there's no fan in the bathroom. We had a very great experience, much better than we expected and we will be going back again.

I am from Honolulu and needed to stay in a hotel during my recent visit home. The Ewa was perfect.The outside of the hotel is not the prettiest. But once you step inside its a wonderful experience. The staff were some of the nicest and most down to earth people I've interacted with while staying in a hotel. Their service was excellent and was the best feature of my stay. The building was built in the 70s but the rooms were clean and quiet and the bed was comfortable. Not that I spent much time in the hotel. It is a five minute walk to some of the better beaches in Waikiki and to Kapi'iolani park, with excellent outdoor space and access to the less crowded beaches on the way towards Diamond Head. The location really is about perfect for a hotel in Waikiki. Right next to some of the major bus routes going into and out of Waikiki. Have brunch at Lulu's around the corner or walk or ride a bus to Diamond Head Grill for the best Ahi plate in town.
