Palm Beach Gardens, Florida

review_body: I've stayed here many times over the years and it's always great to return to this friendly and super convenient location. If you tire of high rise life and big bloated hotels this place is perfect. While it is aging and it shows, they are in the process of renovating this property. The rooms are adequate size and the beds are very comfortable. You can get various configurations with kitchenettes, lanai's, or a standard room. Close to everything and the zoo is steps away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Got a great package that included a Studio kitchenette a car and the parking was included which in itself can be very costly in Waikiki. No view to speak of. Low key and relaxing.

Stayed at the Ewa hotel in October 2013 for four nights. The hotel is in a really great location. Its only two blocks from Waikiki beach down a smaller lane and all of the shops and restaurants that you may need. There is free wifi in the lobby and the staff are really helpful and friendly. The hotel is quite dated but for the cost, I would definitely stay again. Something I didn't realise until I stayed in another Waikiki hotel is the importance of a quiet hotel. Later on the same trip I stayed a few blocks down in a hotel on a side street. It was super noisy so I was glad I stayed at the Ewa for the majority of my trip as it was nice and quiet. My only annoyance with the hotel is that they wouldn't store my luggage for a few days while I was on another island even though I was going to stay with them again on my return. The bed is also super soft and comfortable. Best bed I have had in a long time.

I really liked the Hotel. It is one or two blocks away from waikiki beach so its location is great. Friendly staff, they offer us a package that included wifi, parking, coffe machine, etc. We took the package mainly because we needed the parking. At front desk we were told that if parking was full then we had to give them the car keys, but we stayed 3 nights and we didn't have to.The room was nice, queen bed, old TV, but who cares... There was no closet, my wife didn't like that. I would stay there again.

Stay at the Ewa in September 2013 as the ending to a trip across the US. For the price the hotel is fantastic, clean rooms, friendly staff and so close to all the Waikiki attractions. I stayed in a studio room, which was larger than I expected. I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Ewa for 4-nightsYes, all the previous comments regarding the condition of the hotel are correct: The fixtures need updating, the rooms need painting (saw some rooms being painted though), and new shower inserts were needed in our bathroom. The shower calking in our room was molding because someone didn't strip the old stuff, then use 100% silicon mold resistant calk like I would in my home, and on and on it goes. No views of the ocean as far as I could tell, and we were almost on the top floor. But would I stay again? Absolutely. Why? Because the service was outstanding, the location was outstanding, and the price was outstanding. The parking/Internet/coffee combo package was reasonable ($25/day), and the AC worked well. The beds were comfortable and there were no issues with warm showers. Room service brought up extra towels and pillows within 10 minutes of a call down to the front desk. We even used the tiny stove insert in our room, which came with pots, pans, and utensils. The beach was a 5 minute walk 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, with an ABC General Store between us and the beach. We've stayed at Honolulu Kama'aina hotels in the past, and this is definitely a step above. This is not for the traveler with expectations of top notch mainland hotels, but an excellent overall value stay, with very happy and pleasant staff.

I struggle with this review as it has the good, the bad and the ugly. It really comes down to your wallet and what is most important when you have to make cutbacks and compromises. This smaller hotel is a kind of vintage unit from when Waikiki was in it's hey day. Our room was an end unit that had no view and was not much more than a large closet with a bed and a bathroom. In fact, our room didn't even have a closet or anywhere to hang clothes. I did look in other rooms that were open for cleaning and they were much larger and better than ours since some had kitchenettes.GOOD: LOCATION! A block and a half from the beach and all the action yet far enough to sleep and be peaceful. Two or three minute walk and your there. Same for the zoo. Half a block to the bus system that is easy and cheap to use. The hotel staff was average (good) and the rooms were old but fairly clean. Several remodel projects were underway and it was obvious they were trying to maintain this aging facility. You can see the ocean between the taller high rise units in front. The best kept secret is the rooftop. A great place to sun during the day and take a bottle of wine up to sip on at night. You can look down onto a couple of teen hostels for entertainment. The price I paid was considerably less than the nicer ones but Island hopping for two weeks had to cut back somewhere.BAD: This type of older hotels past their prime attracts families with noisy screaming babies and toddlers. Walls are not sound proof at all. Sometimes your lucky and sometimes your not - we were not. No lobby coffee or crumpets in the morning. Our room had a micro size coffee maker and you have to pay for the coffee packs after the first day. Really? It irks the s___ out of me how some hotels don't get the importance of getting their guests off to a happy start each day. UGLY: Literally, the décor. While I was happy to witness the maintenance staff painting and repairing things, EWA Hotel has a rough road ahead to bring it back to it's original shine. The front entrance was nice but the place next door was kind of ratty.Would I stay here again? Maybe. Great for a shoestring trip or married getaway but not a nice honeymoon if that helps.

This hotel has a great location and friendly staff. The rooms are clean and spacious, if dated. Not to badly though - I've been in much, much worse. Key to me is clean! Coffee, fridge, couple of burners, balcony. All it needs is a little microwave and you could stay here easily for weeks! Internet is free in lobby and purchase elsewhere. No fitness center and no pool, but you're one block from the beach for both! They do need better tv's with better reception. Ours was always fuzzy. I will definitely return here on my future trips as long as they remain priced for the product that they are offering.

This is a hotel that is at the Far East end of Waikiki. It is 1 block from the beach, zoo, aquarium, and has fairly quick access from H-1. The rooms are pretty old and in serious need of updating. No clean sheets each day, or coffee cups, etc. this didn't bother us, but it might some people. They do provide clean towels daily and a bottle of dish soap to do your dishes. Like I said, the rooms are old, but they are clean. Didn't see any bugs. The hotel staff is the biggest asset to this hotel. They were super nice and accommodating. Even went so far as to bring a microwave to our room to reheat our leftovers. I understand that they are updating their rooms, so it should get better. The beds were very comfortable. Considering the usual prices for Waikiki, we would stay here again because we are rarely in our room.

I found Ewa Hotel in Waikiki a great place to stay in Honolulu. It is just a block away from the Waikiki Beach. It is very accessible to the malls, restaurants, pubs, bike rentals, fastfood, church and others. There is parking as well but you have to pay for it. Its $20/day. Got mine for $15 for being a AAA member. Wifi in rooms has a fee to for $8.95/night. But still a great hotel to stay. Very friendly staff

This our family's third time staying at Ewa Hotel. It's a great value, you get more than what you pay for. The best thing about this property is it's location. It's one block away from Waikiki Beach and the famous Waikiki Strip but it's quietly nestled in this little quiet area so you can easily enjoy Waikiki and take a break from it at night. We stayed in rooms 807 and 809 which offered wonderful views of the ocean from rooftop deck. The kitchenette was handy with the kids for as much as you promise yourself you won't go in the kitchen while on vacation, when you have kids, you do. They offer a covered parking lot which is handy. I had a little bit of issue with the wireless but it worked out, they just needed to re-set it. The staff was wonderful!

My wife and I have spent over 5 wks at the Ewa in the last 10 mo's (2 visits). We have stayed all over Oahu thru the yrs and now have a favorite, Ewa. Location is incredible, rooms clean & functional, quiet area but the biggest asset is the friendly, caring staff. Several front desk employees have been there a while which is rare in Waikiki hotels. Brandon, Jon and Etsu do a great job of ensuring our stays are enjoyable. Every afternoon they provide ice water in the lobby. A small thing but after a long day site seeing or at beach, you look frwd to it. I spent most early mornings on the top floor deck with is quite, peaceful and provides a view of the beach. Can't wait to get back soon.

My husband and I stayed one night at Ewa Hotel at the end of our vacation. For the room rate I feel that we got a great deal for several reasons. One, it is located within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach, all of the shops and restaurants, and the marketplace, but is spared the noise and traffic found along the main drag. Two, the room was very clean and had a firm bed, quiet and functional air conditioning unit, a spotless tub and shower with plenty of hot water, and a mini fridge. Three, parking was convenient. Four, all of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and welcoming.This is a comfortable, no-frills hotel that was well suited to our needs, but there is some room for improvement. The room was certainly dated and could use a new kitchenette at the very least. Wi-Fi access came with a fee which in this day and age is somewhat ridiculous and passe. These aren't dealbreakers, but are worth mentioning.I would stay here again because it served as a budget-friendly but comfortable place to sleep, shower, and relax. These were all the needs we had and all were easily satisfied by this hotel.

review_body: Like many have noted the hotel is not the Hilton. Actually I can say this with authority as I stayed at the Double tree Hilton one night. If you need fancy modern rooms, a pool and fitness centre with loud obnoxious people, lip service from unmotivated staff and a small bathroom without counter space and Wifi that doesn't work but still charges you $10 extra for (and a $20 continental breakfast- coffee on top of that). Then go to the Double Tree. If you want a spacious clean room with helpful staff, on a quiet street within steps of the beach and the fun part of Waikiki then Look no farther. I recommend this hotel highly.

review_body: We stayed here for one night at the end of our Hawaii vacation. Location is ok, a little hard to get to with a car (thanks to one-way streets). On-site parking at $20/day seems to be on par with other places in Waikiki.The room itself was clean but dated. The wallpaper was old and the kitchenette cabinet doors were literally falling apart. The furniture was ok and the room was ok overall.The bed was comfortable, linens were clean and fresh. The A/C system worked really well and kept the room nice and cool.If you come to this hotel thinking it's one of those fancy ones on the beach, you'll be disappointed. If you're looking for good budget accommodation, you have a winner.

review_body: The rooms were not great. No microwave. Restricted view. People working there were nice. Marginal parking. Location was excellent Next to zoo. They changed our room to one with a working refrigerator.

You wouldn't choose this hotel for the quality of the room but it was clean and functional with fridges and crockery/cutlery for self catering. It's in a great location, close to the beach and a stroll away from shops and restaurants. Also has easy access to busses if you want to explore further afield.

This Hotel is a little gem, yes it is a little dated but has clean spacious rooms with all you could need in them. Comfortable beds, fantastic shower water pressure, coffee pot plus small kitchenette with mini fridge & microwave. There is an ice machine in the garage. A short walk to the beach and the main strip. Starbucks is a 2 minute walk and the ABC (corner shop) is one minute walk away. The staff are lovely, so friendly, especially John, he went out of his way to help us, so much so we bought him a latte from Starbucks to say thankyou. They were all very helpful priniting us out walking and driving maps on request and suggesting places to explore. The kids loved helping themselves to the iced lemon water in reception, nice touch Ewa.

My boyfriend and I had a great time in Waikiki and our room definitely did not distract from our stay. The room was very clean, had a firm but plush queen bed, a sofa, and a kitchenette with stove, refrigerator, and coffee pot. The staff was very friendly and knows the area well. There were many moderately priced restaurants within walking distance, as well as Kapiolani Park, Waikiki Beach, the Aquarium, and the Zoo.The downside was that this is an older building, the view out of my window was of several balconies in the neighboring buildings, and housekeeping knocked on our door at 9am. Hardly an inconvenience for the price difference between this hotel and many others on the strip.Overall Five Stars for this two star hotel. I would definitely stay here again for the amenities if I visit Honolulu in the future.

Excellent value. Staff went out of their way after we forgot somethings to get them back to us promptly. Great staff. Housekeeping was very helpful when we found we forgot stuff. Front desk went out of their way in helping us getting around Oahu.

Hotel is older but it was very clean inside and all the staff were very friendly and helpful (especially the cleaning staff). The room had a small kitchenett we and fridge which were great to have and the only complaint was our room had 2 twin beds instead of one larger bed and there is no pool at the hotel. Hotel is just quick stroll to the beach and most of the important buses are even closer. I was a bit worried we wouldn't like being on the far end of Waikiki but honestly I think I liked it much better. It was nice and quiet and if you wanted to walk over to the busier side you could whenever you wanted. Overall it was great for the price and we would definitly consider staying again

These people are to be commended. I arrived to a clean and comfortable room. I received distressing news from home of the passing of a friend. Brandon immediately got me the information online as well as local flower shops that could send flowers. I lost a tooth and John got me the local dentist, with directions from the hotel. In two days I was up and running. I had a great time. My room had clean towels every day with Teressa making my bed for me. WOW this place is run like a 5 star hotel with a budget. I can't tell you how nice it is to feel clean, safe, comfortable, and one and half blocks from the beach!

It's not the most luxe hotel, but it is comfortable and they had a room that could sleep 6! Our room included 2 bathrooms, a kitchenette, plenty of room and a lanai to people watch. The staff was alway helpful and very nice. I would definitely stay there again!

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. It was very clean, quiet, and had friendly front desk personnel. I loved the rooftop sitting area. Would definitely stay there again!!!!! The only thing I had trouble with is the WIFI. I went to the lobby to use it free cause I was too cheap to pay for it! lol

I enjoyed my stay at the Ewa. The location is great (about 1.5 blocks from the Ewa beach, in Waikiki) and the service was great. The staff went out of their way to make our stay more pleasant. Thank you John: Your friendly advice made for an interesting tour of the island.

Enjoyed 4 nights at this out of the way hotel. I was upgraded to 1 bedroom with living room, really roomy. Dated but clean. Doors were chipped but carpet looked new. Coffee maker, microwave, fridge, sink, and flatware. Balcony with chairs. I never used air con because it was always breezy with sliding glass doors open. No restaurants or store on-site. 2 minute walk to Starbucks on beach, ABC Market at one end of street. Close to bus stops on Kuhio. Overall really liked this place for the price you can't beat location considering its next to more expensive Hilton and Marriott Hotels. Street is quiet more like an alley. Staff was friendly enough, never gave attitude. Bath toiletries are not very good, bring your own soaps, and lotions if you want something more than basic. Tip, if you only have one bag, take the BUS from airport, it's $2.50 take #19 or 20 about 1 hour and last stop on Kuhio, one minute walk to hotel. Also if you plan on using the bus, buy 4 day pass for $25 it beats carrying exact change and let's you go anywhere on island.

We took this hotel not expecting to be in a 5 star establishment and we weren't disappointed. I would rate this as a 3 star hotel, but having said that, our experience was a very happy one. The hotel and rooms are not like in a new hotel but they are clean, comfortable, well appointed and roomy! The staff are helpful and friendly and the position of the hotel is excellent if you want to spend time at the beach. The rates are very reasonable and this will be the hotel of choice for our next visit to Hawaii. We would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget or you aren't looking for the latest and greatest for your accommodation but would prefer to spend your hard earned cash on other things on your holiday.

Outstanding location in waikiki, nearby kapiolani park, wakiki beach, and honolulu zoo areas.Ewa Hotel front counter staff are very very friendly, helpful and courteous with tourist before, during and after check-in/check-out.The rooms are like kitchenettes, well equipped with microwaves and coffee makers.The only negative would be that the filipina maid/s should wait before removing/taking tourist personal property from the room refridgerators, especially when tourist have not even checked-out of the rooms.Most hotel maids wait until they are notified by hotel front counter guest services staff of check-outs. This could be a serious issue.

Excellent staff and service. Stayed at Ewa with wife and granddaughter so had the two room suite on 7th floor. Came with all we needed....fridge, stovetop, microwave, coffee maker, comfy beds, separate A/C units in bedrooms. Lots of room and so close to the beach!Can't beat it for the price. Yes, rooms are dated but well maintained and we were there for the beach and not just to stay in the room!

It's a budget hotel people! Don't expect a Jacuzzi with room service with steak and lobster! Stop grumbling. The room was old fashioned but comfortable. Kudos to the staff, they are all nice. I like the water cooler in the lobby, a nice touch. Location is great: walking distances to the zoo, aquarium, shops and restaurants around every corner. Of course it's close to Waikiki/Kuhio Beach. Elevator slow though. A room away from the elevator, thank goodness. Also got free upgrade from moderate to kitchenette studio. Fabulous! I will return soon! A satisfied tourist!

Front desk employees were all very helpful and friendly. Great price for the location. Walking distance to everything. Rooms are not as new as other more expensive hotels may be, however they are clean. For the amount of time we spent in our room, it was perfect. A clean, quiet place to get some sleep.

We stayed at the Ewa for 4 nights and it is a good budget alternative to being at Waikiki. If you are planning to be out most of the time then it would be a good pick. It is very dated, the bathrooms are passable, but the bedding is clean and comfortable and the room is well made up each day. The front desk staff knew absolutely nothing about the local area so you would need to be confident at working things out yourself. We asked 3 different staff for advice about pretty basic things over the days we were there and not once did they have a clue. Also, the air conditioners in the rooms make no difference, we slept with the sliding doors to the balcony open at night so it might pay to get a room on the 5,6th or 7th floors. The unique thing about this hotel is that they can guarantee adjoining rooms for larger families. Due to fire regulations you can only have 4 people in a room, and we were a family of 5 and it was a real pain finding somewhere that would do more than 'try' to have an adjoining room. Also, consider getting a ticket for the red 'Aloha Bus' that roams the local area. We found it quicker than taking the pink line and good value for money as the pass is for 48 hours. Bus attendants were friendly and helpful where the hotel staff had not been.

Nothing Fancy about it at all but well worth the money for what your paying. Its located in a great safe area. I stayed there for 11 days. Room was very clean with no bugs. Had a nice little balcony. ABC store where you can get anything you need right around the corner. Only things that they need are a faster elevator and maybe a fan in the bathroom. Other then that we had a great time and would stay there again!

After reading all of these negative reviews I have to admit I was a bit concerned. When I walked in today the front desk guy was super nice and professional. The hotel smells great( unlike that dump in Daytona last year). My room is clean and there is A/C. Great! Super happy. Mahalo ! Mark-room 407.

Hotel is well kepted up , friendly hotel staff, rooms are small,not a bad thing. good location a block from the main drag.one elevator,it groans a little from time to time. be nice if they can do something to the door by the stairs on the 7th floor by room 703 so it won't slam everytime someone uses it.

The Ewa Hotel is fine as a budget hotel. My room was clean and comfortable and was perfect for the price I paid. The few issues I had: 1. There was a large gap between the floor and the door allowing noise from the outside hall to easily enter. Door seals aren't that expensive and would be a nice addition to allow for more privacy and noise reduction. 2. The only lock was a dead bolt. Again it would be nice to have more then one lock to ensure security. 3. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful but couldn't offer me any advice on how to get to Pearl Harbor without a car, which I thought I was bizarre for a hotel in the middle of Waikiki. However, I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a comfortable and affordable stay in Waikiki and who is fine with not staying in one of the higher end resort hotels.

The Ewa Hotel offers the perfect location for a quiet stay in Waikiki. It is close to all the amenities including the bus stop, and to world famous Waikiki Beach. Our room was quiet, clean, but on the small side. The new bed mattress was amazingly comfortable. The coffee maker and mini fridge enabled us to start our day with Hawaiian coffee. I would recommend this hotel to those not interested in spending much time in their room, and are there to enjoy Hawaii. The Ewa Hotel staff provided excellent service, especially with regards to our luggage storage on our arrival and departure days. Much Aloha Spirit was shown. Mahalo !

I got up around 3 am to go to a bathroom and found about a dozen of cockroaches fleeing all over the place when I turned on the light. My room was very tiny and next to the elevator. It was very noisy from people going in & out from the elevator. I don't think I will stay there ever again.

We stayed at this hotel for a week while on the island for the Pro Bowl. It is a great location, only a couple blocks from Waikiki Beach and the restaurants/shops. We had adjoining rooms with a kitchenette and was perfect for all four adults as we each had our own bed. It is a budget hotel, no frills but if you are looking for a clean place to stay this is it. The coffeemaker is small allowing for two cups and the room is a bit outdated but always clean. You are right in the heart of the city so it can get noisy especially in the early morning with the delivery trucks. But we had a patio as well and was great to have the fresh air and place to drink your morning coffee. They had a parking garage that cost an extra 20 bucks a day but was well worth it for the rental car as there is not a lot of places to park. Would stay here again if just needed a clean and decent place to crash.

We came out to Honolulu on short notice for a wedding. Ewa was one of the few places that was available for the nights were needed. I had originally booked 4 nights, but then needed to change to only 2 nights that were seperated by 2 nights. Roy in reservations was extremely helpful. The first night we arrived to find we were given a mini suite instead of a standard room. It was a nice surprise. When we checked in again a few nights later we were given a room on the 8th floor which is on the sun deck. This room had a queen bed, flat screen TV and a refridgerator. The bed was very comfortable. We had plenty of towels. Brendan and John at the front desk are very courteous and pleasant. This hotel has a very good location.

To start off: I'm not a person that writes reviews, although I find them very helpful. However, as I write this review I am in the room 515 at Ewa Hotel Waikiki and i promise to my self never to stay here again. I will list why: 1. I walked in the bathroom to dirty towels. 2. The walls are paper-thin!! I can hear everything that goes on next door, and trust me it is not pleasant. 3. I contacted the front desk to move me to a different room, but say told me it 100% capacity... really/?? 4. After checking in with my girlfriend this afternoon, the front desk person put us on a room with two single beds... joke. I went downstairs and got us moved to the smallest hotel room i've ever been to. Like i said, I don't like "hating" on any business, but I'm a business owner and I would love to hear the truth about my business, so here it is. Do not stay in this hotel if you are paying more than $100 a night.

It is in a great location, with nice reception area. But the bugs are horrible. They seems to be well aware of the problem, but don'tseem to be in a hurry to fix this.A more senior companion and I stayed in room 304 for the night of Feb 3rd.I waked up around 1:00 am due to itchiness. I had bumps on my face, hands, arms, and neck.They looked like mosquito bites at first, small, with white central area. I didn't mind much at first. But when I turned on the lights, I saw a small black bug with red tip, crawling slowly near the pillow. I took a picture and killed it, which left a blood trail. I went to the front desk. A nice gentle man was smoking near the garage door. After hearing my description, he immediately gave me two keys to 302.I went back to my room. Since my companion was still asleep, I moved myself to 302.It was a nicer room. I stayed up until 3:00am, that is when I found another bug around the pillow TOO! It is the same type, but smaller, also a blood stain.In the morning, when I checked out, a different guy had the nerve to scold me to have not returned the keys to 304 earlier. "You are not supposed to stay in two room, but I am going to let it go." I was just too exhausted to reason with him.A few other minor details1)many stains on the wall. looked like residue of dead bugs.2)old sheets. in 302, the bed cover had a hole likely burned by cigarette. 3)we were promised two double beds in 304. They were twin beds.4)now the bites are swollen red5)I am trying to clean everything up.I have never complained this much just for one night, but attitude of the receptionist in the morning was really deceptive and unacceptable.Please avoid this hotel, especially notify your guide or travel agency.It is just not worth the trouble.Please also report to relevant agencies if you had similar experience.

None night before leaving for the mainland. Chose this place based on location and price. Location is awesome. At the end of Waikiki, near the beach and zoo. While it's not on the beach, it's really, really close. Tiki's is close, as is Mac 24/7 and Tokkuri Tei. I'm a fan of all these restaurants, after eating at some very disapointing eseeded a room for tablishments in Waikiki. But, back to Ewa Hotel. Out front is a nice seating area with ashtrays if you smoke. The lobby is small, but clean and attractive. There's limited self parking in the parking garage for $15 a day, which is cheaper than most places in Waikiki. While there's no pool on the premises, the beach is easily within walking distance, and I'd take the ocean over a pool any day. The top floor of the hotel boasts a nice open area with potted palm trees and comfy chairs to lay out in the sun. The view of the ocean from here is lovely, especially at sunset. The downside is the elevator doesn't go to the top floor, you have to take a flight of stairs up from the last floor it stops at. This is especially disconcerting when you have a room at the top floor, and have to drag multiple suitcases up the stairs. I specifically asked for a room with one queen bed. When we finally hauled our luggage in to our room, we quickly discovered we were given two twin beds. For this reason I'm giving Ewa Hotel 3 stars. Not at all impressed with this blunder on the hotel's part. The room had a small balcony, and a mini fridge. Definitely appreciated that. The bathroom was tiny and as clean as it could be, but be warned, the bathrooms are old, and past being able to be cleaned properly due to their condition. There's at least new carpet in the rooms.  I've seen other rooms at other hotels in Waikiki, and I understand many places haven't renovated for a while, so all in all, the price is right for Ewa Hotel. Don't expect luxury, make sure you're not on the top floor if you have a lot of luggage, and if you reserve a room with a queen bed, I suggest verifying this is what you actually get, before you haul your belongings up to your room. Ewa Hotel is a quaint, rather quiet old hotel in a great area of Waikiki, that is affordable, thus allowing you more money to spend on food and activities. After all, who wants to spend all their time in a hotel room when they're in Hawaii!

I planned to spend my time at a hostel I won't name. Thanks to some horrible infighting among the residents, I decided to look for an alternative halfway through my stay. Ewa came through and I'm so very happy. Perfect location close to the beach and the zoo; Starbucks, ice cream, burgers nearby. Room was clean and spacious. Bed was comfortable. Furnishings were old and somewhat dinged up, but worked perfectly. The only thing that was sub-par was the water pressure on the 5th floor. But I was able to stroll to the #2 bus for all my touristy travels and had a wonderful base from which to explore Oahu. I'd be happy to return any time.

Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: We spent 9 nights at the Ewa. Its location can't be faulted, close to the beach, The Bus, and the main tourist strip. The room was clean and the bed comfortable, it had a fridge and a coffee maker (which we didn't use because Starbucks was around the corner). There was next to no information on what to see and do, but there are stands along the street with all that so I don't suppose it was a big loss. The wall between the next room was not well insulated for sound and we had one lot of noisy neighbours.The internet in the foyer was slow and in the room it was expensive, but there is a Starbucks and a McDonalds nearby and they have free internet. If you want to be near the big hotels but not in them, the Ewa may be for you.
user_name:
Andrew P
Kiama, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I paid so little for this hotel that I was expecting it to be really average, but it was so much value for money. Although its not central to the heart of Kalakaua Avenue, its still so close to everything and there is still a lot of nightlife nearby. Furnishings were really nice, although we got two single beds which I didn't expect. Will definitely stay here again!

My family and I recently spend 10 days at Ewa, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We stayed in a two room suite. (A main room with two beds, a tv, kitchenette, microwave, and then a smaller attached room with two additional beds). It worked perfectly for our family of 4. The room was not the most up-to-date room I've stayed in. The furniture and technology was slightly outdated but never dirty. The lock (which uses a real key) was sometimes hard to open, and there was some noise from the rooms next to us. Despite all of these things, I still give Ewa 5 stars because the staff was fabulous and helpful, everything was very clean, including the bathroom and kitchenette), parking, although an extra cost, was easy, the beds are absurdly comfortable and clean for a budget hotel, and LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. This place could not be in a better place for easy access to the best of Waikiki. An easy 2-block walk to the beach, one block to the zoo, and many restaurants and attractions all around. The roof has a lovely private area with plants, tables, and chairs for enjoying a meal or laying out in the sun. No pool but why would you need one when you're a 3 minute walk from the ocean? Our view of the city/mountains was beautiful from the private balcony. I would have stayed forever if I could have! I'll never stay anywhere else in Waikiki.
