Zach C
Greenfield, Ohio, United States

review_body: I stayed here for ninety days from mid-September to mid-December. This was my tenth time to stay here in the last fifteen years. In March Aqua Hotels took over management of the hotel and they are continually making improvements. There was a coffeemaker, refrigerator and a microwave my the room. The entire staff was friendly and gave me good ideas of places to see and restaurants to try. There were no major problems during my stay. A light bulb did burn out in my room and maintenance replaced the bulb in only a few minutes. The housekeeping department did a great job keeping my room clean. I look forward to returning for trip number eleven in September.

My husband and I stayed here December 2012 I loved the parking. As far as Waikiki goes, its the best. We booked a regular room granted it did say 2 twins or 1 queen but we got the 2 twins of course. We were on our honeymoon, so that was kind of disappointing. We ended up taking off the mattresses and put them on the floor :) all in all its a good hotel if your looking for nothing fancy just to sleep there. There's no amenities

We stayed in a queen bed room with a city/mountain view for three nights in November. We selected one of the cheapest rooms we could find but were not disappointed. Our mountain view was actually Diamondhead which I really liked seeing the sunrise over it. The room was small and the furniture was not the latest styles but everything worked and was clean. The carpet looked very new and very clean. We had a nice little minifrig under the TV. The entire hotel was clean and well maintained. Parking was in small spot and was $20 a night but a special advertised for $25 you could get wifi and parking. One odd thing was that we started with two washcloths, two hand towels and two bath towels. The second day we only hand towels and bath towels and the third day we had only bath towels. It was not really a problem and we could always ask the front desk for more towels. The location was great with the zoo one block away and Waikiki Beach 1.5 blocks away. The front desk had signs highlighting the free movie on the beach one night. The bargain price compared to other hotels that had shady neighborhoods or cleanliness issues. Definitely would stay here again.

Great place to stay for a weekend. Great location and good pricing for the rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful. I have stayed at the Ewa on each of my trips to the Islands over the last few years.

Myself and two friends stayed at Ewa Hotel Wakiki for 7 nights in November 2012 and found it to be a wonderful hotel with friendly, helpful staff. The hotel was only two blocks from Waikiki Beach and very close to transport (The Bus and trollies). It was also very close to the famous Teddy's Bigger Burgers!! We had a great time on our first visit to Waikiki and it helped knowing we had a great place to stay each night. I would definitely reccommend Ewa Hotel to friends & family and would not hesitate in staying there again in the future.

This hotel is wonderful! When i go back to Honolulu, i will stay there again. I am recommending it to all my friends who will be visiting Honolulu. The location is extremely central. Only a couple minutes walk to the beach. The staff members are very friendly and helpful especially, John. The housekeeping also did a wonderful job.

This is a great budget hotel in a perfect location, a block from the beach in Waikiki, 1/2 block from Kapiolani Park--my favorite area in Waikiki. It's spotlessly clean with pretty white bedspreads and a good supply of towels. We got a great internet rate from a comparison site for a studio with twin beds--it was only 2 nights so my husband and I jumped at the rate, but were upgraded to a 1 bedroom with a queen bed, and the twin beds in the front room. The room was well equipped with TV, kitchenette, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator and cutlery/plates/cookware. We had a balcony that faced the street. WiFi and parking costs extra. There are no amenities like a pool or fitness center but the front desk is manned 24 hours a day with friendly staff. First class shopping and restaurants are on Kalakaua, but lots of great deals can be found on Kuhio and Kapahulu Ave. The city bus runs on Kuhio, which can get you all over the place. if you don't care about all the extras and just want a clean, quiet room near the beach this is the place to stay.

We stayed in Ewa hotel for two nights in october 2012. Hotel staff are nice, the rooms are a bit dated but clean. The location is perfect - only a few blocks from the beach. All in all I think its good value and would stay again.

A budget Hotel run like a 5 Star Hotel. It starts with going beyond expectations.The cleanliness of the entire Hotel. Service... I never expected daily clean towels and someone at the front desk 24/7 giving the feeling of safety. My room was on the 3rd floor and I never had to take the elevator.. they read my mind when I checked in, and I could open all my windows for fresh air, never turning on the air conditioner. Who could deny the 5 star location. One block from the famous Waikiki Beach and shop till you drop on your walk till you get there. The furniture was well used, but well taken care of.

I recently stayed at the Ewa Hotel in Waikiki....it is an older property but it was immaculately clean, and the housekeepers were super friendly and helpful..the only problem, no pool, but you are 1 block from the beach..also you are across the street from the Marriott which has numerous shops, so the location is superb......i thought it was great for the price, though the next time I go I will get a larger room.

The place was in a great location. Rooms were fine for the price. Nothing fancy but slept well in beds. Could use some updating. Front Desk staff were great. Pointed us to fine dining establishments and entertainment. Rented scooters and drove to see downtown Honolulu and Diamond Head.

We stayed at this smaller hotel recently and we enjoyed it. Although not fancy, it is clean, affordable, comfortable beds and the staff is very friendly - especially John at the front desk. Michelle, the senior housekeeping staff sees to it that the maids do their job. The beds are very comfortable and the hotel is very close to the beach - about a 2 miniute walk. It is also down at the quieter end of Waikiki Beach closer to Diamond Head. Still, plenty of hotels, restaurants and shops very nearby. We would definitely stay here again as it is affordable and you can even get a room witrh a kitchenette so that you can save money on eating out all the time if you so choose. My only negative comment is that it could use some renovations however some have already begun such as new carpeting - so hopefully they will continue upgrading some things such as the doors and some new wallcoverings. If you can overlook these things , which I'm sure they will get to, you will find it comfortable. Also it has a great roof top patio with a view of the ocean in between the surrounding tall buildings. We felt safe here as there is good security and the parking lot is patrolled. All in all a comfortable place to stay for the price.

Im not a hotel snob. Meaning i don't have to have egyptient cotton sheets and granite in the bathroom. All I need is cleanliness and affordability. Ewa hotel had all of these. I had a room with two twin beds with a kitchen/mini stove/refridgerator. Even though the beds were twins they were a lot more comfortable that where we stayed 5 nights previously (turtle beach hotel).The hotel needs updating and there were lots of scrapes, dents and such in the walls. our outlet in the bathroom didn't work, but we made due. And come on now, how much are you really in your rooms while in Hawaii. The only thing I didn't like was that there was no safe in your room. however at the reception desk they had one in which they gave me the key too. the clerks stated that they do have them on order for all the rooms though. I paid $10 per day to park, but you can park for free next door at the zoo. The location was prime and Im really glad I stayed at Ewa hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.Thanks

Just returned from a whole week stay at this hotel in Honolulu. It is in the western side of Waikiki, close to the zoo. My hubby calls it the "back-alley" hotel as the entrance appears to be in an alley...nothing too pretty about it and seems to be in need of some upgrades (wall paper!) but definitely good value. It is very close to the beach, trolley stops for all 3 lines, restaraunts, fast food. Room was very clean and suprisingly pretty big. I was also surprised that it had a mini kichenette with a fridge, stove, sink and even dishes and cutlery! Definitely a place to brings kids. I am a little disappointed that wi-fi is not included...I would have liked it to plan for places to eat and rent a car, etc. Carpet was clean and relatively new, bed was very comfy but the wall paper needs to be replaced. Super friendly staff, who was available 24 hours and very helpful. Nothing fancy like a pool or restaurants or work-out gym but that's how they can keep the place price low. Overall ery positive experience and would definitely go back.

I just returned from Honolulu and stayed at the Ewa for the first time. I enjoyed my week stay in September, 2012. The hotel itself is close to the beach for the surfers and swimmers. It is quiet and off the beaten track but close enough to the trolley stop to make it a great location. My room was very clean, but in need of a bit of paint and a door replacement for the bathroom. The hotel location is very quiet, and with the exception of noisy neighbors who I could hear talking clearly through the adjoining room door, until the wee hours one night, I had no complaints about the exterior hotel noise. The housekeeping staff are terrific but they started very early each morning vacuuming, which did not allow for sleeping in, so if you are an early riser, this would not be an issue. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for good value for a nice room with a kitchenette (two burners, a sink & fridge). No microwaves in the room though for reheating. They are available for an additional cost if you request one. The non stick frying pan was pretty rough but otherwise, a good set up. Bring your own spices & condiments, and ziplocks and you'd be good to go.

This hotel has the basic amenities that you need and is very close to the ocean. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful, taking time to give advice on sightseeing opportunities that went beyond the standard places. While replacing the locks on the doors, they provided security on each floor. They also provided lock boxes for valuables, because the safes in the rooms are to be replaced soon. The hotel posts quiet hours, and I slept very well without interruption or noise.

When I booked this hotel I was promised free upgrade and complimentary breakfast. I never got the upgrade and we ended up with the smallest room next to the elevator. Upon checkin we got a small basket with 1 pot of jam, 2 sunny delight, 1 small pack of instant coffee and armenian bread. The next night we asked for the same thing and were told it is 1 basket per stay. The attendants were mostly rude and didn't care. The internet never worked and the AC is right above the bed and leaked all over the matress....

On very short notice, Ewa management first booked two nights and then five subsequent nights during the busy July 2012 period.. The room was clean and comfortable, with AC and hot water (all I needed). The cleaning staff did wonders and the front desk was very helpful. I had the window open 24/7 on the fifth floor. Mind you, this is in a quiet spot near Kuhio Beach and at those rates, you don't need a five-star box.

Travelling with two friends so we booked three rooms for 10 days due to location and rates. One room had a blocked toilet which took two days for them to fix. Then the air conditioner began leaking water on to the bed.I had been promised a room upgrade upon check in yet I ended up with the smallest of the rooms and no balcony.After spending well over 1,000 each so over $4,000 they then proceeded to charge $20/night for parking and laughed when I complained.I could not in good conscience recommend this place to anyone. You'd be better off at a backpackers or a hostel.

We stayed at Ewa for 6nights, and had nothing to complain. The hotel are two blocks away from waikiki beach, which takes you no longer than 2 minutes to walk. ABC store not far away so you can buy something to your room. The room are enough placed for two persons. The wall are abit thin so you can hear the neighbours tv and they talking. Other than that we would return, definetly. You are getting the value of your money!

I spent 5 days in July 2012 in Ewa hotel. Staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was outdated (which is fine) but looked very worn. The walls were dirty, the toilet was "runnnig" 24/7, the water took forever to become warm, and the sheets not changed/bed not made daily. No breakfast provided, no beach towels, no parking, and no airport shuttle. The hotels location is picture perfect! A block from the beach, a few steps to ABC store(s) in every direction and just down the street from the Honolulu Zoo. Good resturants (in other hotels) very close by. The air conditioner was lovely & seemed like a new addition to the room. The hotel did hold our bags until we left at 10pm, since check out was 11...but no shower room or late check out as an option. All & all it was a great vacation with my hubby, we picked this hotel strickly on price and location to the beach..if you have the extra cash - consider elsewhere.

My June 2012 week long stay at the Ewa Hotel in Waikiki could not have been more pleasurable.The first thing that that was apparent to me when I got out of my rental car in the enclosed Ewa parking garage when I first arrived was how clean the garage was. I easily found an available spot and upon entering the lobby, found that this seemed just as clean as the parking garage – a very good sign.My check-in was quick and effortless and Brandon who checked me in was courteous, professional, and friendly. Also, since my flight back to the mainland was in the evening, Brandon stated that I could check-out at 1p instead of 12 noon on the day of my departure.When I exited the elevator to walk to my room on the 5th floor, I noticed a strong odor of cigarette smoke. When I entered my room, it seemed clean but also smelled of cigarette smoke. I phoned the front desk and Brandon apologized, stated that smoking was not allowed at the Ewa, and offered to change my room. I was then given a larger room on the fourth floor that was spotless and smoke free.Throughout my stay, all staff at the Ewa Hotel were top notch and so helpful. I was very pleased with my new room and housekeeping always kept it spotless. All staff were also very courteous and friendly - which means a lot when you're thousands of miles away from home. The next time that I'm in Waikiki, the Ewa Hotel will be at the top of my list for accommodations. I would also like to add that my room safe could not be opened in my room during my stay so I was offered to store my valuables in the safe deposit box at the front desk. Bob at the front desk then informed me that they were discounting my parking 50% because of this inconvenience. Thank you Bob! This is what good customer service is all about and your kindness meant a lot and was most appreciated.

The rooms need to be remodeled. Rooms are a bit "used" and walls are dirty. They have NO breakfast in the morning and they charge you for parking! They wanted to charge me twenty dollars a day to park, which would have been $140.00! I threw a fit and they just charged $10.00. Hotel staff was very friendly though and always took care of my needs. They have two small laundry rooms but close by 8pm.Hotel is only one block from the Waikiki beach and shopping which was nice.
Two blocks from the beach, ABC store right around a corner.Basic facilities. No breakfast. Desperately need a restoration.Helpful and friendly staff. Clean. Very cheap.

The hotel is about a block away the beach. Its located in the central of the world famous Waikiki Beach. Hotel is clean and staffs are friendly. I have two full size beds and it has a little kitchen in it. There no ocean view but I can see it from the rooftop. I like sitting on the rooftop with a glass of wine watching a sunset. There is a famous Gay bar (Hulas bar) just around a corner. Also this hotel is gay friendly too. The room is about $79.00 per night. I def stay here again.
Very helpful and friendly staff: front-desk, management and cleaning personnel. Great location: only a few minutes walk to the beach and the main promenade. All in all, great value. Would return.

I have to admit - when I booked my stay at the Ewa Waikiki Hotel my primary criteria was price. I figured I'd spend most of my time away from the hotel, so I wasn't greatly concerned about the quality. Surprise! This hotel really surprised me. It was extremely comfortable, a bit on the old side, but spotlessly maintained, and the staff was friendly and courteous. It was a short, 5-minute walk to the beach, 5-minute walk to Kapiolani Park, 5-minute walk to some good restaurants, convenient to a lot of things. It's located on a quiet cross street just two blocks from the beach, but a very quiet place to go relax. Book it for the price, then enjoy the comfort!

I've stayed at many properties in Waikiki. This has been one of my favorite properties for the price and location. Probably not a full 5 star rating; maybe 4.5. Room is small but average for the area. Bed was very comfortable. Room was very clean. AC unit was the best of any in any budget hotel I've stayed in in Waikiki. Always clean towels. No balcony. :-(Staff from the desk personnel to housekeeping were extremely friendly and helpful and friendly though I wish housekeeping were quieter in the morning especially around rooms with "do not disturb" signs on the doors...like mine.

We spent 6 days at Eva Hotel at the tail end of May 2012. And was chosen because of its location and being off the beaten path. Although an older property, it is well kept, and we felt right at home. You won't get a mint on your pillow, and no bellhop, just a down home clean safe place to enjoy your stay. If your lucky you will meet Bob at the front desk. This man made me and my 11 year old son feel right at home! He had great tips on the sights and dinning around the area. Always greeted us on our coming and goings from the hotel. Truly a dedicated employee, and will insure you get the most of your stay in Honolulu. All in all the complete staff makes this Hotel a hidden jewel in Honolulu! They truly understand the meaning of Aloha!

This hotel is in an older building, and the room is not fancy, nor does it have a view. I was able to see a bit of Queens peeking out from the building in front of it.The staff is friendly, helpful and intelligent.The stove is old, old, old. The plates and utensils are mismatched and look old, too.The bed is heaven! I haven't slept so well in decades. I don't know what kind of mattresses they use, but I want one for myself. I'd stay in the hotel again just to sleep well.For the money, it's a great value.

..........Okay, the rates are great, the location is great and the overall hotel is very comfortable and quaint to say the least. However, the jewel of this property is the STAFF ! Probably some of the nicest and most acccommodating people you will ever encounter. Our stay from 05/12 - 05/17/2012 was the best. First we have Christina (hostess with the mostest) who from they very onset treated us like we were long time friends. Secondly, there was Brandon (a very nice young man who, combined with Christina, afforded us an upgrade based on availability. Last, but not least was Itsu (sp?) who assisted us with using the internet to expedite our flight back to the mainland and let us check our luggage behind the counter as our flight was not until about five (5) hours after check-out time. Therefore, we did not have to tote our bags all over Waikiki until the time we needed to head for the airport. Talk about Hawaiian Hospitality, this great group of people have it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Mr. Petera (GM) (sp?), you can be proud of your staff. As for the maids and other staff, all were great. One minor comment - leave two (2) coffee packs in the room. We enjoyed our morning coffee on the large roof top terrece everyday. A big thank you to all at the EWA. Sincerely,David and Michael (2 Traveling buddies)

Stayed for four nights in mid-April and was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room. They were also painting the lobby while I was there. The decor is very mismatch, but who cares if it's clean (renovations have been done piecemeal over time). The range burners were old, but everything else in the kitchenette functioned (new frig., no microwave, no coffee maker, bring your own knife to cut your pinapple). There is a washer and dryer for affordable rates! Staff very friendly. Great location next to the zoo and park. I hope the low rates remain, so I can stay there again!

This hotel was a God send for us. I grew up in East Waikik and this hotel was one block away from where I lived. I haven't been able to afford to come back to Hawai for 50 yrs. if you have sticker shock looking for a place to stay close to the beach try the Ewa hotel. It is an older hotel but boutique in style nestled amoung all the expensive high rises. We had a mini kitchen in our room that helped cut down on food expense. To coin a phrase "We'll be back" Mahalo. Good service and nice folks.

We have stayed at the EWA Hotel in Waikiki for the past 7 years for no less than a month (30 days) at a time.If you are accustomed to high end accomodations on holiday, then this is not for you. We have always enjoyed our stay as the staff have been very accomodating and professional. The location of this property is it's greatest asset. The deck on the 8th floor is also a good asset. The entire property could use a lick of paint especially the elevator areas on each floor. The breakfast in the AM consisting of boiled eggs, toast, juice, coffee and donut holes are a nice feature however when we were last there Nov. and Dec. 2011, we noted a number of rotten eggs in the batch. We brought this to the attention of management however I don't believe anything was done about it. I understand that new owners have recently taken over the property and perhaps improvements will be made. Hopefully so. Needless to say we will be staying at another location as they no longer offer long term rates. We will certainly miss the staff and friends we have made over the years at the EWA and we wish the new owners success in operating their new property. Dave and Marian

We really enjoyed our stay at Ewa Hotel in April 2012. Great value, room was clean,bed was soft, staff was helpful and location was great. Steps from Waikiki Beach, Kapiolani Park, the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium. Exercised in the mornings,hung out at the beach,got things to eat and drink at any number of places in close proximity. Dont understand why people complain? Act like they paid Premium price so they Deserve Premium service. Many other hotels in Waikiki for that. Thank you Ewa Hotel for allowing two Locals to recharge and act like tourists.

Had a great stay prime location just a block from Waikiki Beach. Rooms were clean and serviced daily. Front desk staff, especially Bob, were friendly and accommodating of our requests. Breakfast was discontinued on the last day of our stay, but there are two ABC stores less than a block from the hotel, you can easily take care of essential breakfast, snack and beach purchases cheaply. Would definitely stay here again.

My background: 31yo. maleI have stayed in Hawaii, Oahu approx 7x since 2010. I have stayed at the Hilton Village prior, but found it was too pricey for what I really need.Going to Hawaii, you'll be spending most of your time outside; so ideally you only need a place to sleep and shower.I've stayed at EWA hotel 4xLocation: Prime Location, 1 block from Waikiki Beach, 1 block from Starbucks, Large ABC store around the corner, 1 block from Bus Stop, 1 block from the Zoo. Price: one of the cheapest hotels in Waikiki!Room: it was decent, but then again all I needed was a bed and showerService: nice workers/housekeepersParking: They have a good sized parking lot 2$/hr max 16$/day I believeWiFi: unfortunately really bad signal, but it's free.If you're like me; only spending time in your room to sleep/rest or shower. This place is a steal! I would leave early AM, surf, eat out, get some sun, shop, and get back by 8-10pm. And just pass out in the bed. I've done the luxury hotels prior, but in the end, it wasn't worth the money vs. the time spent in the hotel.

Six months ago, we would've recommended this place because the staff was friendly and reasonable. Now the staff is rude, skimps on everything from toilet paper to towels and room cleaning. First, we paid more money to stay for a weekly rental instead of a daily rental. Then we were told that as a weekly guest, the room would be service only ONCE A WEEK. Afterwards, we could only get 2 more towels to the two already in the hotel room, for a total of 4. AND OUR ROOM IS ONLY SERVICED ONCE A WEEK. So when we asked for more towels, they thought for whatever reason we had 6 and refused. Not sure why they thought we had 6 towels and why the maids would refuse towels to a guest that is staying for TWO weeks and only service the room ONCE a week. Eventually, it was cleared up, but then they REFUSED TO GIVE US TOILET PAPER. Again, we are staying here for two weeks, room is only serviced once a week and we ran out of toilet paper. I made it a point to politely ask what did the hotel staff think we should do without toilet paper. After several dumb stares and a long discussion, eventually I was able to get ONE more roll, but this is ridiculous. Again, we are being charged more but getting less service. The other ridiculous thing is that they claim to have only one room key. However, if you get locked out or whatever situation comes up, they have another key at the front desk or the maids have keys to the room. Really don't know what to think of hotel now. Do they really think they can save on costs if they limit room keys, towels, and service? This isn't the Ritz Carlton or the Hyatt, there's no room service, concierge, bell hop, gift shop, bar, travel service, fitness center, swimming pool, or restaurant. It's just the basics (room, bed, bathroom, wifi, business center) and a complimentary continental breakfast on the weekdays. They don't have the extras, but it's difficult to just get the basics. Other hotels are more than happy to service your room daily if you stay long term. No arguments over towels and toilet paper. The WiFi is free, but a little slow. Parking is reasonably priced. Location is great. If you are on a budget you can chance a stay here. If you can afford it, go somewhere else

We stayed for 8nights at the EWA Hotel and was pleasantly surprised prior looking at "trip advisor" before our stay.I dont know what people expect for a cheap CLEAN hotel in a PRIME location. The beds are very comfy and i slept like a baby. Everyday the friendly maids will make your room up (service with a smile). our room had a nice feel, quiet air con unit that has perfect temp control. The breakfast is laughable, it simply is not breakfast, consists of toast with doughnuts with a tea or coffee, we bought a box of cereal for $5 job done or breakfast options in town are endless and cheap. If you are looking for a budget hotel in a good location that meets good standards then this is the hotel for you. Dont expect hilton standards because YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!! Great staff, great cheapy option perfect for our Hawaii stay!! Keep up the good work :)

Stayed 23rd March 2012. Room was infested with bed bugs, they don't come out until it is dark and you are in bed. I killed several of the bugs which had been sucking my blood. Gross !!! Luckily I was checking out anyway.However front desk didnt seem to care about it. Management havent bothered answering emails. Luckily I took photos and video to prove it.Don't let the bed bugs bite and stay somewhere else, there are other better budget options.

This hotel is 3 minute walk away from the Waikiki beach. It provides affordable accommodation close to the beach. You will have to pay for parking at the hotel. It costs 15$ a day for the parking. The room that we stayed in had below par ambiance. The floor was dark and dull, the bed was too soft, and the bathroom was tiny. They serve juice and donuts in breakfast in their dining room. I am not sure if i can call the hotel good value for money, but i can say with conviction that its location is prime.

My wife and I, once again stayed at the Ewa Hotel at 2555 Cartwright Rd. in Honolulu ,Oahu. It is a very good location at a little more than one block from Waikiki Beach and a block from the Honolulu zoo and two blocks from the Honolulu aquarium. It is a mile walk to the Saturday Farmers market (Kapahulu to Monsarrat by Queen Leahi Garden) at the entrance to Diamond Head Park Memorial hike. It was as expected: clean, comfortable and well aged. The standard twin room was large enough with two comfortable twin beds. The beds had pillow top mattresses. There were two slim pillows and one thick pillows. Each bed had a reading light. The air conditioner was quiet and efficient, The small refrigerator was wonderful for cold drinks, yogurt and salad. There was free WiFi. The rug was fairly new and clean. The bathroom was clean; however, the shower curtain had a ‘sour’ odor and needed a bleach job. The bath faucet handle was broken and hard to manipulate. Requests to have it repaired were ignored. The maid service was daily clean towels and beds made with carpet vacuumed.  There are no balconies with standard twins.; however, there is a large, little used, communal Balcony on the eighth floor with some view of Waikiki beach and ocean. We left a ‘generous’ tip ($20?). Maids and desk clerks were helpful and kind. They were a little ‘stressed’ as there was a Ewa Hotel ownership change during our stay. There was a most welcome lemon ice water decanter in the lobby for all thirsty guests.  There is boiled eggs, donut holes, ‘weak’ coffee, orange juice, toast, butter and jelly on the second floor from 7am to 9am daily including weekends. There are tables and chairs; a book trading corner with desk computers. On many occasions, ‘rude’ guests went in through the hostess door before 7am; helping themselves, while the harried hostess was trying to get things set up. The hostess had a ’Godly’ Patience with them and remained outwardly cheerful. Some guests were selfish enough to take the few offered newspapers back to their rooms for their private use; leaving the communal room with none. The Patience and Cheerfulness of the ENTIRE staff sets an example for the Humble!  There is car parking at $2/hr or $15/day. We suggest you forget the car and hike and/or use the greatest full island bus service (The BUS) in the entire civilized world. You will get back in shape, while eating the ‘to die for’ specials, and happy hour (4pm-7pm) at Moose McGillcuddys on Lewers St; one mile North on Kuhio from the EWA. You can also walk to the BEST Thrift store on the island, one mile east on Monsarrat accessed by Kapahulu ave. to Monsarrat (by the zoo). There you can buy all varieties of vintage and modern Hawaiian Jewelry, clean clothes, kitchen ware and books; for pennies on the dollar ; AND every penny you spend is donated by the sponsoring church and volunteers to help the homeless and needy on Oahu! (so ‘spend’ your tithe there!) In our perception and return experience; the Ewa hotel is the best location, service, most clean ‘BUDGET’ hotel we have experienced in Honolulu. We would recommend it to all other budget minded folks willing to accept that they can not expect the ‘Ritz’ for the price paid.

At time of check in the staff didn't even crack a smile, not even a welcome.They were the nastiest people I have ever met in hotel industry. At check in they asked for my credit card for incidentals, I travel a lot and I know places do that sometimes, but usually they let you know in advance. There is no smoking in the hotel anywhere and their little dumb paper that we signed said that if you are caught smoking anywhere in the hotel, they will charge 200 dollars ... When they gave us our keys washer room , it was an old key with a number plastic keychain... gross do hotels still have that? we walked into the room and it smelled like smoke Dear lord I thought ... they will charge me $200 if I stay here because they were already not very friendly to begin with. We went downstairs and asked for a different room. they said that they are all sold out... but the lady said that the do have another room and it is open. ok we finally get our key. and there is only one key they didn't have another one they said but the next day they magically had one made even though it looked just as old as the other one... then we asked to get one bed instead of two tiny once ... we got quite a glare from all of the front desk clerk.. So two men asking for one bed were not really excepted. Our room also had a shower cap covering the one smoke detector in the room and I asked the front desk what that was all about and the answer was that they have to do that when they ionize the room so that the smoke detector doesn't go off.. That's just downright illegal. BREAKFAST : this is not a joke ... I am going to post a picture of this ... the storage room for the breakfast stuff was wide open and I had to take a picture ... all the eggs are NOT REFRIGERATED and there must of been a weeks orth of food with no refregiration in a warm room...  and next to cleaning supplies ... GROSS ... The cleaning crew however were really fast and nice.checkout was another nightmare with quite an attitude and no eye contact what so ever.There is however a change happening with this hotel Aqua hotels is taking over this lost cause and I am really hoping things will change, because this place has such potentials.Some tipsWhile staying in this hotel or any other for that matter tip your housekeeping if you like how they clean and take care of your room. Usually housekeeping are the lowest paid and hardest working.Do not eat their breakfast, there are so many nice places right next door.

My partner and I were on vacation and he was curious about this hotel, so we made reservations after staying at another hotel in Honolulu. When we arrived the staff had nothing but stern, unwelcoming looks on their faces. When we checked in, they didn't even show one sign of customer service or people skills. They also handed us a sheet of paper that had their rules printed on it, they have a fee for checking in, no guests after 10pm, no smoking in the rooms or there is a $200 fee, how they want you to use the shower, a fee if you needed linen or towel service other than the times they do housekeeping, that is all I can remember now but it made us feel like we were being babysitted, it was ridiculous. On top of that, when we got to our room, it smelt like cigarette smoke. We didn't wanna get fined if they accuse us of smoking, so we asked for a new room and also a room with one bed. When we asked for one bed, they just looked at us and we can feel them judging us, we're a gay couple. We just stayed there for the remainder of our vacation and during checkout, they didn't make any eye contact with us, they just looked down the whole time and also didn't even communicate with us to let us know we were checked out.Overall, bad customer service, shabby rooms, stupid rules, not accommodating at all, horrible rates.Also the management of the previous hotel we stayed at, White Sands Hotel (which was wonderful), is taking over Ewa Hotel so maybe they can bring the place up to par with their very good customer service and wonderful staff.

Stayed for 8 nights at this budget property. Room had 2 small twin beds, quiet air conditioner, no lanai, clean bathroom, clean carpet, noisy connecting room. Hotel still uses regular keys so no updated key card or audit tracking of who has entered your room. Safe in room was great at 2.00 per night. Front desk service was fine but they liked to ignore you when you came in by being too busy on their computers. Way of the world I guess. Housekeeping was sparse on soap, tissue and shampoo but kept the room clean. Breakfast was adequate if you liked toast and donut holes or hard boiled eggs. Saw some younger people removing platefuls of eggs and toast to their rooms while the attendant was busy. Sad but this will probably kill the free breakfast. Coffee was very weak but a nice touch. Large group took over tables in back for hours talking, drinking and eating. Guess they figured they had a monopoly on seats while we others searched high and low for a seat.All in all ,Value for money and great place to be as is near beach and park, restaurants and bus lines.

For the price, this is a great hotel. It is very basic. I chose it over other hotels for the free breakfast. That was a mistake. The first morning I ate a very bad hard boiled egg (how do you mess that up? Maybe it was old, I don't know.) The breakfast was tea, coffee, HB eggs, and toast. The toaster didn't work very well.On the other hand, it is close to the beach at half the price of other hotels in the area and within walking distance of lots of food places. I was with my 11-year-old grandson so Subway, Burger King, and McDonald's were our preferred dinner options. It was noisy so even though it was cool enough to just leave our sliding glass door open at night, we used the AC because open windows meant sirens and traffic noises all night long.
No frills, but clean and right near the beach. Staff was helpful and always present. This is great place to sleep and then GO OUT AND SEE HAWAII.No POOL - NO Bar - No FrillsGreat parking

Stay twice in this little hotel, locatino u cnt beat , 1 block from honolulu beach, free simple breakefast donuts & cofee, free internet is +++++, rooms cleaned , price 59$ per nite was great. parking 10$ great .

Rather decent budget hotel (but still costing me $88/night) with clean basic rooms but with lukewarm front desk service, except for the caucasian (white) fellow who went out of his way to help me in so many ways. Breakfast is simply "ridiculous"; hard boiled eggs and the orange juice served everyday I spent there (Nov. 11 to Nov. 17, 2011) are the highlights: I never could understand why they don't provide you with forks; when asked for one, the attendant simply replied "Ah just eat with your hands", funny isn't it? Proximity to Tiki's (a great restaurant and bar) was a plus for me.

Although the hotel is out dated, it was comfortable. The gentleman @ the frontdesk was friendly & informative. Glad there was a stair case next to the elevator i made use of it quite a bit. (only one elevator I am glad my room had been on the 3rd floor). The room was large a one bedroom apartment with a mini kitchen. Nice living room with a dining area. Beds were small but comfortable. Housekeeper had a bad attitude.

My feet hang 7" over the end of the very hard bed that i layed towels down to sleep on because of the dirty conditions of the room. The doors were falling apart it was just dirty and in bad need of upkeep. I know the price meant it needed to be updated not falling apart and filthy.

We've decided to stay there last two night of our 3 weeks hawaii holidays. It is a cheap option, but surely you can get a lot better value for your money in other hotels. When we walked to the reception we were almost scared of the person behind the desk. Very unfriendly... We walked into our room and were in shock, walls were yellow almost brown (not deliberately), strong smell of smoke and very old fashioned furniture, aircon was partly hanging of the wall and fly screens were ripped. It was seriously the worst room I've ever seen. We went to the reception and said the room did not meet our expectations and after a while we got offered another room, which was one level lower, but exactly the same. We were willing to pay more for and upgrade, but there was no such an option. Very very bad experience, I won't even mention the breakfast.... Do not stay in Ewa hotel!!

the hotel comes more economic than competitors and you get what you pay. The structure is very old, room furnishing is very poor too. The room was very silent however. The hotel is located at the end of Waikiki beach and next to the Zoo. I personally suggest to stay on the other end, in between Waikiki and downtown.Just I'm not sure coming so far to Hawaii to stay in a old broken place makes sense, unless the cost is really that important for your trip.

This hotel balanced price, location, and my actual need (which was nothing more than a place to sleep for a one day layover in Honolulu). I would not choose the room I was in for an actual vacation. The hotel, and the room I was in, were well worn. It could use considerable updating ... but that needs to be balanced with price ... which was reasonable. The doors do not hold back any sound at all. Too early in the morning the housekeepers were talking in the hallway and you could hear every word perfectly while in bed. Speaking of the bed ... the twin I was in was extremely comfy. The other twin in the room seemed more worn. Sliding glass door onto Lanai was off it's track, basically unusable, and not clear if it could be fixed. A/C was great. Parking is not included and is fairly high ... beware. There is some on-street parking. Location is just fine ... not right on Waikiki but plenty close. Front desk folks were impeccable (perfect). Housekeeping knocked on my door at 8:00 a.m. ... can you believe that? And I was checking out that day. Breakfast has short hours (7-9 a.m.). It is good enough to fill you up; nothing fancy. Horrible coffee (can I repeat ... horrible! Slightly flavored, barely colored water.) In summary ... if price is a major consideration, but not quality ... this is an OK place to stay. You should get a pretty good nights sleep.
Amazing staff, very friendly and helpful, hotel is old but very clean and very good location, two steps to Honolulu Zoo and next door to the beach. Good value for a money.

I booked the hotel because all I needed was an overnight stay after major wine dinner (didn't want to risk driving "under the influence"). For less than $100 (including parking and taxes), the Ewa Hotel provides clean rooms and good service. They don't have a lot of frills (the room keys are still keys, not electronic cards) and room service ceases at 4:30pm but I'll be back if I'm ever in need of an overnighter in the Waikiki area.

Stayed for 10 nights at end of a 9 week USA tour. Excellent location for the price just 2 short blocks from the front at the quieter end of Wakikki. Major, noisier end less than 10 minute walk away. Major bus routes (we used - 20,22 and 47 ) very near and cheap. Reception helpful but not overtly friendly. Bedroom clean and beds exteremly comfortable. Drab decor but fine if only using the hotel as a base to return and sleep in. Continental breakfast the same every morning - Orange juice, Tea/Cofee, Toast, Boiled egg(s) - cold, small doughnuts but pleasant dining room . Seating arrangements meant fellow visitors ended up talking to each other. WiFi in room worked well. Compared to other parts of USA Hawaii is expensive so the price for this hotel was good. We were there over Haloween which was exciting and fun. Recommend Cheese Cake factory, Pearl harbour, Diamond head, Hanauma Beach and the Polynesian Cultural Centre near the north shore.

Located in a side street in the quieter end of Wakiki Beach (Diamond Head) and is convenient for the beach the zoo and public transport. Parking for a fee is available. This hotel is clean, comfortable, although the rooms are somewhat on the small size. The airconditioning unit was directly above the bed which resulted in water occasionally dropping on to the bed. The room had no safe. There was plenty of hot water and towels were changed daily.Very little in the way of tourist information available and depending who was on duty on the front desk resulted in the amount of interest or information received.Lots of rules and regulationsDo bring along your original documents of confirmation as they tried to charge me a higher rate than originally booked.There is a great patio area on the 8th floor with sun-loungersA basic but adequate breakfast is provided each morning.

I walked down a dimly lit corridor on my way to room 301 on my recent stay. I passed a mysterious stain in front of room 310. I booked the cheapest room I could find at the Ewa Hotel. It's a little old but the staff is friendly and its a good value. They have free wifi in the rooms and continental breakfast. Just a place to sleep and get ready for the day. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean.

We stayed here for a week. I would stay here again and I would recommend to stay those who are looking for the budget hotel. We rented a studio superior room.Here's the breakdown of Pros and cons: Cons:-The burners were too slow.Pros:-Great location, a block from Waikiki beaches, shops, and restaurants.-The bed was very comfortable.-Breakfast included; toast, hard boiled eggs, and donut holes was perfect for us! -The staff is very helpful.-The internet speed is OK, not great, but exceeded my expectations.

This small hotel is located on a quiet side street, not far from the beach and from the zoo. If you're looking for all the action around the International Marketplace, this is not the location for you. However, there is still enough going on in the immediate neighborhood to make things interesting -- the Marriott's half a block away, Tiki's is an interesting place for live music, and Lulu's also has a nice vibe, and for some Hula's bar is a mecca. The hotel staff at the Ewa is very friendly, with lots of aloha. Things are small and quiet enough here that it's easy to strike up a conversation with the front desk staff. Pool lovers should note that this property has no pool. Rates are very reasonable, but you do get what you pay for -- if you're looking for a pampered, luxury experience it would be best to go elsewhere.

I stayed this hotel for my business trip. I had to wake up early and I went to bed around 11 pm, and then 10-15 young people's party began at the next door. Every 30 sec, girls screamed and laughed, every 5 min, people knock the door and in n out... I totally awoke at midnight, gather all stuff and went front desk for changing my room. If it's just a little 'noisy,' I wouldn't have changed my room though. Besides I mentioned down grade the room at the same price is fine, but there were no available lower class room. So a man gave me better room for me, but I was so tired to move my stuff at the middle of night.

We stayed at a couple of different hotels in Honolulu. The Ewa was our favorite. Its location is terrific, parking is reasonable, the rooms were very clean, and they threw in free breakfast, to boot. It's definitely not a luxury hotel, but we were interested in a place to sleep, not a spa. It was a fantastic deal: about $85 a night! I wish I had foregone the other places and just spent the whole trip at the Ewa.

located in the best part of town, close to shops, bus stop, restaurants but if you have booked your tours most tour companies do not offer pick ups from this hotel so you may want to think but for self drive its a nice place to stay. Bedding was awesome. I would stay here again.
Nothing fancy here (kind of old) but clean and very convenient to the beach, the zoo, and Diamondhead. If you do not want to spend the big bucks typical elsewhere in Wiakiki, try the Ewa.

It was gross. Would like to upload pictures so you could are how bad it was. From the brown and yellow popcorn ceiling to bathroom door that was broken and painted three different colors during different repairs of it.

This is a vert bus ride to ty minimalistic hotel on a great location bang on the Waikiki beach and a short bus drive Diamond head, a little longer bus ride to the Hanuama bay which is great for snorkelling. Staff are helpful and friendly. Rooms are basic but cleaned well everyday. Hotel charges extra for everything from a iron to hair-dryer or microwave if you have taken one of the kitchenette rooms which our friends with a little kid did.The biggest dissapointment was the free breakfast. Certainly not continental. Basically consisted of bread, eggs and fried sugary donuts!! The sad part is that bread kept running out 4 out of the 6 days we were there.I guess for the location and price I will stay here again but if I have a little more cash I wont.

We stayed here for a week. I would recommend to a friend and I would stay here again. I was a little unsure at first, but I feel the pros definitely outweighed the cons. Here's the breakdown:Cons:•Needs updating. The handheld showerhead holder was broke, but we made it work.•If/when you have someone stay in the room next-door you'll realize how thin the walls are, you can hear everything! •They don't have towels you can bring to the beach, and beach towels at walmart are about $10, so bring one if you can!Pros:•Great location, a block from Waikiki beaches, shops, and restaurants.•The bed was super comfortable, couldn't to fall into this bed after a long day of walking or hiking!•Breakfast included; toast, hard boiled eggs, and donut holes was perfect for us! •Beach mats available for use.•Loved the sundeck! Didn't use it much though. You can see the ocean from there.•They kept the rooms clean! Never saw any bugs in any part of the hotel!•Laundry available! Washer $1.50, dryer $1.25 (detergent $.50 at the front desk)•The staff was friendly, and helpful, available if you have questions about the area as well as the hotel!Overall, we enjoyed our stay! Get over the part that this hotel needs updating, you won't spend that much time in your room! Also, something you may find helpful, we found better deals on gift items at Walmart, and at the International Marketplace, where you can talk them down on prices! Don't go for the "only this price for you", I'm sure they say that to a lot of people... Anyway hope this helps!

Me and my gf stayed a week at ewa may 6-13 it was a nice hotel the rooms were very small and elevator was old and really slow. Service was good and everyone was nice close to the beach and all the store on Waikiki. It was a very clean and we really enjoyed our stay!!!!! For the money it was a good deal.

The room size is about 10' X 16'. Sort of a size "shock" at first :-). However; after initial adjustment to a small amount of space in both the room and bathroom (5'X10'), things "settled down." We mostly were very grateful to have staff say: "welcome home" each evening. Bath was especially kept clean by daily maid service (only found one dying cochroach the entire week - no big deal :-), fresh paint, caulking and tile. Daily linen change, floor vacuumed (new carpet) and bed made. Newer air conditioner worked quietly and efficiently with remote. Small working fridge in room. No balcony. Hotel inside and out; pretty quiet. Window view to alley and other hotels. 8th floor sitting deck with partial ocean sighting (we never used it); cleaned each morning. Fresh coffee, OJ, donut holes, wheat toast, butter, jelly, hard boiled eggs and free newspaper (7am to 9pm on second floor with nice tables to eat and visit at). Local and few people make for more interaction with other guests and staff. Very HARD working, kind, respectful staff. (we left larger tip, for staff, than usual). We were able to walk to the best beaches (free public hula show on beach; tue,thur, sat. & sun. 6:30 -7:30 pm) and restaurants (including President Obama's High School "haunt": The Rainbow Drive In! (large Barbecued Roast Beef Sandwich on bun $3.55!) Close bus stops (seniors with medicare card $1! AND transfer!) and easy access. Walk to Half price Happy Hour,daily specials and 2 for 1 breakfast coupons at Moose McGillicuttys on Lewers St. Aquarium and Zoo 1 to 2 blocks away!

I stayed at this hotel for a week while visiting Honolulu. While it's certainly not the newest hotel, I did enjoy staying there.I stayed in a studio superior, with two beds and a kitchenette.Things I liked about this place:* A block from the beach, and they'll hold your key for you so that you can leave valuables at the hotel and not worry about it when you're out swimming.* ABC Store around the corner.* Most of the staff was pretty friendly.* The Kitchenette and Fridge were handy, especially since it came with some plates, silverware, a cutting board, glasses, two electric burners, coffee mugs and a toaster.* Coin-operated laundry machines, since I tend to only bring a few days of clothes in one backpack and wash it in the middle of the trip.* Free breakfast with eggs, toast and donut holes (until 9am)* Roomy closet* Free internet (it looks like they run DSL to every other room, which then acts as WiFi AP)* Sun deck on the top (which wasn't busy at all, and was a nice place to hang out with friends who were staying nearby)Things that I wasn't thrilled about:* There wasn't a light over the kitchenette, which made washing dishes in the sink a little bit difficult.* The air conditioner in the room (Japanese style) didn't seem to be properly sized, since it took a few hours to cool down the room. This wasn't a big deal if we left it on, but yeah.* There was a little bit of a musty smell which went away after we aired out the room. I wasn't sure if the previous guest had used mothballs or whatnot.* The safe wasn't free to use, though it seems like charging for access to the safe is a pretty standard practice. We opted not to use it, but left everything valuable hidden away when we were out. Nothing disappeared.Things that amused me:* The carpet doesn't really match the room at all, but seemed fairly new* The elevator had a bit of character; sometimes it would inexplicably stop at random floors, particularly the third one.* It's on a side street, so it's pretty easy to miss, but it also doesn't get a huge amount of tourist traffic either, and was reasonably quiet.

I stayed in the Ewa Hotel for two days in February 2011. The hotel is located in 2nd row to the beach and accessible from a side street. The street didn't make a good impression on me, but you should not judge from that to the hotel.The staff at the reception was friendly and helpful. It seemed that the room and hotel was renovated a short time ago. The bed was comfortable and everything worked fine. A plus is definitely the silent and efficient AC. Free wifi was available without any problems. The only negative point is that the parking isn't for free and you cannot find a free one in the neighbourhood. Nevertheless the parking rates were reasonable. The continental breakfast was plenty and the coffee was good.

To find a good place with good price at good location on the Waikiki beach was not a kind of easy thing. However, after a long lasting search I have found and have decided for Ewa Waikiki Hotel. Location: not direct at the beach front, but in the second block, so just few steps away from the beach. Room: wow, beautiful. Everything was fine. Clean and spacious. A/C worked well. There was also TV in room. Non-smoking room was also fulfilled,. Amenity: free WiFi! Breakfast: incredible, included in price! Not that fancy one, but including doughnut, cooked eggs, toast and jams together with coffee, tea, orange juice. Just enough for a healthy start for the day. Staff: very helpful and even concerning about you. Conclusion: best price, very good service, great location. What more do you need for a place to sleep just direct at Waikiki beach! 5 points.

The street it's on is a glorified back lane (1st clue). Elevator door is rusty, has paint missing all over, and makes a lot of banging noises (2nd clue). Hallways have the oldest wallpaper, discolored and peeling (how many more clues do we need to know what's coming??). The room was tiny, smelled like smoke (although no smoking allowed), had discolored peeling wallpaper with moldy patches, doors had pieces of wood missing and were in bad need of replacement, never mind painting. The 'furniture' should be put on the curb for garbage day; couldn't even garage-sale that stuff. Air conditioner vents dirty. Adjoining door very thin, could hear voices on other side easily.Acceptable points: Housekeeping looks like they try hard to do their jobs but there's only so much they can do. The owners of this hotel just don't care. The towels were very white and clean, bedding was the same. Bathrooms look like they have had a reno in the last 20 years or so and therefore were ok...don't know why they didn't do the rest of the room!This is the worst hotel I can remember staying in (and I stay in a lot). We had a standard room, maybe the suites are better. Do yourself a favor and pay an extra $20 to get a better place. I try to be positive when I review a hotel as I'm pretty easy to please as long as the place is clean and in good repair. These rooms are bad.

This hotel is great, great value, great location awesome breakfast. we would forsure come back tot his hotel without a question. the staff are very helpfull....its not a 5 star hotel by far.....but come on how much time do you spend in your hotel room, it's great...has all you could need for enjoying waikii.......we would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again....

I have stayed at Ewa Hotel Waikiki several times and have been well satisfied on all trips. The front desk staff is very attentive and friendly. Housekeeping keeps the rooms tidy. I talked to Sebastian to verify my upcoming reservation and he told me Gloria is no longer working there.

Nicely located about 1block from Waikiki beach and all the actions and attractions. You can catch a bus in any directions - car not necessary. The hotel is being renovated. New carpet in every room and the bed is comfortable.Daily room service. The kitchenet has two stoves. There were two pots available. But only one is good for cooking or for stir fry. Bring along your favourite pot or pan if you are planning to preprare your dinners. Breakfast is provided with your stay. Bread, buttter, jam, boiled eggs, Canadian Timbits, tea, coffee and orange juice your basic breakfast. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Overall a good price hotel for under $100.

The hotel was fine and as expected for the cost ($89/night). The only complaint we have is that clothing and other personal items mysteriously disappeared over the course of our stay. Obviously we brought too much stuff as hotel staff thought they would help us out by alleviating our load and helping themselves to our stuff. Unfortunate because the location and cost was just right, but I guess one gets what one pays for. In this case, ripped off!!! When we confronted the managers all they suggested was to file a police report rather than apologize and help us obtain back our things. Since only their hotel staff has access to rooms it is fairly obvious the culprit. Anyhow, I recommend the hotel but don't bring anything (clothing or otherwise, including medications) you might need or care about. Aloha!

Rooms are clean, mine had new carpet. Beds are very comfortable. Room has a balcony with a view ( ya not just another building, but the mounts are in ½ view and pleasant. ) The AC cranks and I used it much! Staff very friendly – and shared some wonderful Dinner eating places. Breakfast is boiled eggs, toast and coffee / Tea and OJ. Location is perfect 1 block from Waikiki beach. EWA has mats, chairs etc for the beach for free. Also near to the Zoo, Diamond Head and Aquarium. If you have a car they have parking reasonable rates. Wifi included. They don’t nickel and dime you like some hotel chains. There is no pool and the sun deck is closed for renovations – The ocean is perfect – I would not care to pay extra for a pool or sun deck; but that’s me. Its comfortable, reasonable rates and you will enjoy your stay. Good value in great location in a beautiful location of the world. I stayed at the Hilton the week before – 2.5 times the cost. I would return to EWA rather than the more exotic but pricy hotel.

Booked in here by my production company. My Hawaiian producer thought it was hilarious that i'd been put in "some 50 buck hotel."But actually I'm rather fond of the Ewa. It does everything simply , well, and cheap. Breakfast is boiled eggs, toast and coffee. Rooms are clean, staff very friendly. You can be on a board surfing 10 minutes after walking out the door. What's not to like about that ?

Stayed here for 1 night while transiting HNL. Location is quite good, but the room was very small. It was only just adequate for a single traveller, but would have been too small for two people. There was an old double bed in the room, but no table, so I had to use the fridge for this purpose.On the plus side there was free wifi and continental breakfast, which was adequate.I have stayed in nicer places in Honolulu for similar money.

The Good:> Friendly and helpful staff> Clean room with new carpet> Free breakfast of donut holes, toasts, eggs, coffee and orange juice> Affordable rates with free wi-fi> In a more quiet location in WaikikiThe Bad:> The room is dated and smelled moldy the first time we walked in> Old, small and slow elevator> New carpet is checkered blue and beige... not exactly our taste of decor> Dated room appliances

I spent 7 nights at the Ewa Hotel Waikiki at the end of August 2010 and found the place to be just right for me. I arrived 2 hours before the check-in time. The friendly young local gentleman at the front desk got me checked in right away, my room was ready. I asked for a microwave oven (for a nominal fee), it arrived within 5 minutes of my request. The next morning I asked for a rubber shower mat (it was rather slippery in the shower/tub), it also arrived immediately. Both deliveries made by a friendly member of the housekeeping staff. In fact, every staff member I encountered was just extremely nice. Everytime I walked through the lobby the front desk clerk would acknowledge me. From a security standpoint this made me feel very safe there. Many of the guests were Japanese tourists who are just incredibly courteous and not loud or roudy (unlike some). My room was on the 6th floor right next to the elevator--only once did I hear talking outside my door for a few seconds. There is brand new carpeting, a pillow-top mattress and a silent yet incredibly effective air conditioner. I love being down near the Kapiolani Park end of Waikiki where things are much quieter and less hectic. The beach is just about 3 short blocks away. The rooftop observation deck is a relaxing spot with chaise lounges and views of the ocean and Diamond Head . All in all I found the Ewa Hotel to be a great value and a wonderful place to experience the true Aloha Spirit of Hawaii. I look forward to a return visit some day.

We booked this hotel over the phone with a very pleasant woman who gave us a rate for a 2 bedroom suite that was very affordable, read back to us all the reservation details, and agreed to send an e-mail confirmation. When the confirmation had not arrived by the next day we e-mailed to ask for one, only to receive a confirmation for a much higher rate (over $70 more per night). When we called to clarify what was going on, the manager told us he would check with the original woman who booked the room for us - she would be there within a couple of hours, and they would call and/or e-mail a response. But 24 hours later no response had come, and when we called once more we were told sorry, but they had made a mistake and the room quote was for a 1 BR, and no they would not make any accommodation for their error, and no explanation given for the lack of response. We were most disappointed, booked with another hotel, and recommend one be certain to get an e-mail response ASAP confirming the rate.

I would like to say that the staff was very pleasant and helpful.As for the hallway carpeting. When I left on the 21st of April they were finishing up the second floor. I was on the third and the carpet had been done as well as the carpet in my room was new. The week of my arrivial they were doing the 5th floor. As for the bed, it was very comfortable. Yes some of the furniture might need refreshed but one does not stay in their room all day admiring the furniture. You want to get out and walk around, go to the beach and visit other sites. But one step at a time. I am sure that once they get their hallways in order that they will commence painting and renew the wallpaper in the rooms and possibly updating some of the furniture.. With that I thourghly enjoyed my stay and definitly would stay there again.Thank you Ewa Hotel Staff.

Well the location was great and the staff was very nice and helpful. The carpet is horrific and dirty but....they had signs up in the elevator stating that they were going to change all the carpets out. I did see them working on the carpet on the second floor when I left on Monday 4-19-10. The new carpet is a dark navy blue. The hotel needs paint in all the room and new furniture as well and hangers to hang your cloths up. The breakfast is bad and the donuts were old. I think if they add fresh fruit like pineapple and mango with fresh donut, muffins, and or mini bagels it would help. The deck looks really bad and needs paint and new lounge furniture as well. Its something I would not like to sit on. The carpet in the rooms look real bad and the frig and TV needs to be updated in my opinion. Not enough tables in the room but the bathroom and tub were very clean. Since the carpet is being changed and they seem to be getting things in order I would stay again next year because it fits my budget for travel and Im not into paying for rooms that run $800-1000 for just 4 days. The owner really needs to get things in order at this hotel if he cares about his business....upgrade it from top to bottom because it relly needs it. If it were not for staff and their excellent customer service this business would get a one in every section . Even the houskeeping staff was very nice and polite. ..

Our experience while at the EWA Hotel wasn't a bad one. We were not told prior to our stay that there is no elevator to go to the top floor and we had three strollers to move up and down daily. The rooms are adequate. They are kept quite clean and the furniture is all in good condition. However, it is an old hotel and the carpetting and appliances of the rooms show it. What ruined everytihng for us was the way were treated upon check out and in phone calls proceeding our stay. We were told of a "special longstay rate' prior to book in that Gloria had told us she had us booked in for. Upon check out we were not giventhe special rate and Gloria (who was there) denied making that statement at our booking time. The manager said he would clear up our bill for us when we emailed our info on our home computer to them. When we did so, we were told that it was too late. The room had been chraged to a credit card adn they would not be giving us a credit, regardless of our hotel emailed proof.

We have been staying at this hotel for the past 4 years. The property is older with view amenities such as a pool, restraunt, shops etc. The staff are very professional and friendly. What sells this property is its location only a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Very quiet area. The rooms are neat and clean. Improvements are being made and understandably the carpets are in need of replacement. This along with a needed interior paint job would greatly enhance this property. Overall the room rates are good for long term stays. A number of Japanese and Canadian guests stay at this property. We will definitely stay at the EWA again.D and M Gallant

I stayed this hotel for 4 nights. The room was fine, pretty old but nothing bothered me. If you stay there you should't pass through Lemon Street just next to Cartwrite Rd. (Especially, if you are female traveler.) There were some homeless look group every night. I didn't have good impression it. The hotel doesn't have swimming pool but Waikiki beach is only 5 mins though it's really congested.I noticed that a bed lined was not changed to new one. It was pretty disappointed. There were only soap and shower cap in the bathroom. It's good real hotel if you just stay for sleep.

I stayed at the Ewa for nearly 4 weeks. It is a 2 star hotel and therefore cheaper than most, but is quite comfortable and certainly adequate. The staff are friendly, it is clean, and with the smallest kitchenette I have ever seen (in my room), allows you to save by not buying out all the time. It does show its age however, and the owners are slowly updating things like the carpets, beds, etc. If you don't want to pay high prices, and want to be very close to Hawaii beach, I can recommend the EWA.

I choosed this hotel based on other reviews about its good location and price. For much less of the price some nearby hotels charged, this hotel provided an average service in a very good location.This is not a luxury property and it shows signs of time, but the room was comfortable (with buildings blocking any natural view). As I intended to spend very few time at the hotel, I found it OK to the pay what I did for it. No breakfast, but there were a number of options around (nothing memorable).Waikiki beach is located 3 blocks from the the hotel, and if you like to shop around there are plenty of souvenirs and clothing stores very close.Luis M., Caracas-Venezuela
